0.title: Tomato prices rise up to ₹60 per kg in Pune
0.article_body: Prices of tomatoes in Pune have risen up to ₹60 per kg due to factors like unseasonal rain in some tomato producing areas, rising temperatures and transport costs. The prices of several other vegetables have also witnessed a rise. The prices of tomatoes rose to ₹40 per kg during this period last year.

1.title: Bharti Singh booked for allegedly hurting sentiments of Sikh community in viral video
1.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against comedian Bharti Singh over an old video in which she allegedly mocked men with beards. The FIR was registered in Punjab's Amritsar on Monday night on the complaint of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee, which alleged that she had hurt the sentiments of Sikhs. After the clip went viral, Bharti had issued an apology.

2.title: SEBI proposes banning celebrities from promoting crypto products
2.article_body: SEBI has recommended that no prominent public figures, including celebrities and sportspersons, should endorse crypto products. It added that firms advertising cryptos and digital assets should put up disclosures listing out the possible law violations. This comes after the Advertising Standards Council of India (ASCI) in February said crypto ads must carry a prominent and unmissable disclaimer.

3.title: More than 1 lakh people disappeared amid Mexico's drug war
3.article_body: More than one lakh people have "disappeared" in Mexico since 1964, the government data showed as families urged the government to carry out more effective searches and investigations. Organised crime is among the leading causes of missing people in the country, the UN said. Cases of disappearances have spiked since 2006 after then-president Felipe Calderon began a war against drugs.

4.title: North Korea reports 1.48 mn 'fever' cases amid COVID-19 outbreak, deploys army
4.article_body: North Korea has reported 1.48 million cases of 'fever', while 56 people have died amid a nationwide outbreak of COVID-19, the country's anti-virus headquarters said. The country's leader Kim Jong-un has deployed a 'powerful force' of the army to all pharmacies in Pyongyang. At least 663,910 people are under quarantine in North Korea.

5.title: We've felt support, it's hard but we're not alone: Sam on Britney's miscarriage
5.article_body: American singer-songwriter Britney Spears' fiancé Sam Asghari took to Instagram to say that the couple has felt the support of their fans after Britney's miscarriage. "We are taking things positively and moving forward with our future. It's hard but we are not alone. Thank you for respecting our privacy. We will be expanding our family soon," he wrote.

6.title: KTR has disturbed mindset: T'gana BJP leader over remarks against Amit Shah
6.article_body: Telangana BJP Vice President NVSS Prabhakar criticised Minister KT Rama Rao for calling Union Minister Amit Shah a "Liar's Badshah". "He is a man of the masses, calling him a liar shows the disturbed mindset of KTR," Prabhakar said. He further alleged that Telangana government has "cheated on Dalits" by not giving them three acres of land as promised earlier.

7.title: KKR share farewell video after Ajinkya Rahane ruled out of remaining matches of IPL 2022
7.article_body: KKR took to social media to share a farewell video for Ajinkya Rahane, who has been ruled out of remaining matches of IPL 2022. "Guys...I really enjoyed my time, on and off the field with everyone. Learnt a lot as a cricketer, about life, about everything," Rahane said in the video. The video contained moments of Rahane from the tournament.

8.title: We are still a poor country, to be honest: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath
8.article_body: Online stockbroker Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol, "I don't think there's an opportunity to build many $100 million valuation businesses in India because we are still a poor country, to be honest." He added, "There cannot be 1,000 companies with a $100 million valuation because that would mean them having at least $10 million revenue."

9.title: Mumbai account officer clicks on link to update PAN card, loses ₹1.80 lakh
9.article_body: A 34-year-old woman, who is an account officer in Mumbai, lost ₹1.80 lakh after she clicked on link sent to her for updating her PAN card. The woman said that a fake HDFC bank page opened when she clicked on the link, after which, she was asked to enter her user ID and password. An FIR was registered in case.

10.title: De Villiers, Gayle inducted into RCB Hall of Fame; franchise shares pics of their medals
10.article_body: RCB have introduced their Hall of Fame, with Chris Gayle and AB de Villiers becoming the first two players to be inducted into it. De Villiers played for RCB from 2011 to 2021, while Chris Gayle represented the franchise from 2011 to 2017. RCB also shared pictures of the Hall of Fame medals to be given to the duo.

11.title: India should be ready to launch 6G services in 10 years: PM Modi
11.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said that India should be ready to launch 6G services in the next 10 years, adding that a task force has already started work on it. The 5G technology will contribute $450 billion to India's economy in the next decade and a half, PM added. He said India is today the "world's biggest mobile manufacturing hub."

12.title: India came out of 2G era of corruption, moving towards 5G & 6G: PM
12.article_body: India came out of the "corruption" and "policy paralysis" of 2G era and rapidly moved from 3G to 4G and now 5G and 6G, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday. "Our telecom sector is a great example of how self-reliance and healthy competition create a multiplier effect in society and economy," PM added.

13.title: 435 PMAY houses in TN's Pudukkottai never built, exist only in files: Probe
13.article_body: At least 435 houses under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) were never built in the Avudaiyarkoil block in Tamil Nadu's Pudukkottai, as per an investigation by district administration. The government paid beneficiaries the eligible amount but the houses exist only in files. The matter came to light following a complaint claiming several houses were not built but payments were made.

14.title: Was really nervous when I got back on stage after 2 years: Pankaj Udhas
14.article_body: Veteran singer Pankaj Udhas has said he was very nervous when he performed live on stage after a gap of two years. "Before...pandemic, there used to be a lot of confidence in me before any concert. But pandemic phase was tough, even psychologically," he said, adding, "Though I did my riyaaz regularly...there was a lack of exposure to...stage and audience."

15.title: Amit Shah reviews security preparedness for Amarnath Yatra
15.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday held a high-level meeting to review the security preparedness for the Amarnath Yatra, scheduled to begin from June 30. J&K LG Manoj Sinha and Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla were among the officials who attended the meeting. Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board members also participated in the meeting via video conferencing.

16.title: Low-floor Kerala buses not in usable condition to be turned into classrooms
16.article_body: Kerala Transport Minister Antony Raju said that the low-floor buses in the state that are not in a condition to be put back on roads after the pandemic will be converted into classrooms. "We felt let it be a new experience for kids," he said, adding that the request for the initiative came from state Education Minister V Sivankutty.

17.title: Williamson doesn't get out, keeps wasting balls: Piyush Chalwa
17.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Piyush Chawla has said SRH should drop their captain Kane Williamson for the remainder of IPL 2022. "Abhishek Sharma is batting really well but he isn't getting the support of Williamson. He tries to play the big shots [but] Williamson takes up so many deliveries, he doesn't get out and keeps wasting deliveries," stated Chawla.

18.title: Govt relaxes wheat export ban, to allow export of consignments registered before May 13
18.article_body: The government on Tuesday announced relaxations to its order banning wheat exports. "It's been decided that wherever wheat consignments have been handed over to customs for examination and registered into their systems on or prior to May 13, such consignments would be allowed for export," the Ministry of Commerce and Industry said in a statement.

19.title: Over 1,100 kg ganja seized from truck along Assam-Tripura border, 2 arrested
19.article_body: Assam Police on Monday seized 1,183 kg of ganja from a truck along the Assam-Tripura border and arrested two persons. The police seized the drugs after intercepting a goods carrier truck coming from Tripura at around 11 pm on Monday, said Niranjan Das, Officer-in-Charge of Churaibari watch post. The apprehended individuals are aged 20 and 18 years.

20.title: 2 BJP MLAs, others booked for 'arms training camp' in Karnataka school
20.article_body: Karnataka Police registered a complaint against two BJP MLAs, a Bajrang Dal leader, a Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) leader and others in connection with an 'arms training camp' organised in a school in Kodagu. Bajrang Dal and VHP organise such camps every year however, no permission was sought this year, police said. Weapons including 'trishul' were distributed at the camp.

21.title: Paytm Mall's valuation drops nearly 100% after Ant Group & Alibaba exit firm
21.article_body: Vijay Shekhar Sharma-led Paytm Mall saw a nearly 100% decline in its valuation after its early investors Alibaba and Ant Group exited the company. Sharma on Monday announced that Paytm Mall's business will now be built on Open Network for Digital Commerce.  The company is now valued at $13 million against its peak valuation of $3 billion in 2020.

22.title: Twitter deal cannot move forward until CEO shows proof of spam accounts data: Musk
22.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday said the Twitter deal cannot move forward until CEO Parag Agrawal shows proof of spam accounts data. Musk wrote, "20% fake/spam accounts, while 4 times what Twitter claims...My offer was based on Twitter’s SEC filings being accurate...Twitter's CEO publicly refused to show proof of <5%. This deal cannot move forward until he does."

23.title: Was scary with vans shaking, black out: Manushi on sand storm during Prithviraj
23.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar said there was a sand storm during the shoot of 'Prithviraj'. "I was on top of a sand dune...I could see them [crew] waving and shouting...Suddenly someone...pushed me down and I literally rolled down the sand dune...It was a little scary when the sand-storm blew over us, with vans shaking and a black out," she added.

24.title: Hyd Traffic Police, GHMC remove silt from drains; pics surface
24.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Monday shared pictures of it removing silt from catch pits or stormwater drains in multiple areas of the district, in coordination with the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC). The drains were at waterlogging points at Bahadurpura roads, Hanuman temple, Gurudwara road and Akshaya Hotel, it said. "Thank you for the great work," a Twitter user said.

25.title: India responds after Pakistan passes resolution on delimitation exercise in J&K
25.article_body: India has responded after National Assembly of Pakistan passed a resolution on the subject of the delimitation exercise in J&K. "We categorically reject the farcical resolution," Ministry of External Affairs said. "Pakistan has no locus standi to pronounce on or interfere in matters that are internal to India, including the Indian territories under Pakistan's illegal...occupation," it added.

26.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launches INS Surat, INS Udaygiri in Mumbai
26.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launched the Indian Navy destroyer warship INS Surat and frigate INS Udaygiri in Mumbai on Tuesday. "I shall be in Mumbai to attend the landmark event in the history of indigenous warship building when two frontline @indiannavy warships...will be launched concurrently at MDL," Singh had written on Twitter earlier. He had also shared pictures on Twitter.

27.title: UNICEF warns of 'catastrophic' child malnutrition due to Ukraine war
27.article_body: UNICEF said severe malnutrition in children could go to "catastrophic levels" due to the Russia-Ukraine war and pandemic disruptions. Soaring food prices caused by the war are set to drive up the cost of "life-saving" therapeutic food treatment, it added. Around 13.6 million children under five suffer from severe wasting, a condition where children are too thin for their height.

28.title: Who doesn't like glamour: Boney on daughter Khushi's decision to enter B'wood
28.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor spoke about his thoughts on the acting debut of his daughter, Khushi Kapoor. "Kids don't come out with their true ambitions right from the start. They start by saying, 'I want to do modelling'," he said. "When they cross the age of 19-20, the thought that they want to act develops firmly...Who doesn't like glamour?" he added.

29.title: He's 50/50, we'll know in a few days: Pant on Prithvi Shaw's availability
29.article_body: DC opener Rishabh Pant, on being asked about the fitness status of Prithvi Shaw, said, "I think he's 50/50. We'll know in a few days." Shaw, who has now missed DC's last four games due to typhoid, last played against the LSG on May 1. The 22-year-old was discharged from the hospital ahead of DC's game against PBKS on Monday.

30.title: Japan to conduct 'test tourism' before full reopening
30.article_body: Japan on Tuesday announced that it will allow small group tours for limited foreigners and assess them as test cases before taking a call on full reopening. The country will allow tourists from the United States, Australia, Thailand and Singapore, who have been triple-vaccinated against COVID-19. The groups will be accompanied by tour conductors at all times.

31.title: Govt to train 20,000 J&K govt officials in grievance redressal: Union Minister
31.article_body: The Centre will train 20,000 J&K government officials in grievance redressal and the task will be undertaken by its Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said. PM Narendra Modi has accorded the top priority in bringing the overall development in J&K and the Centre is committed to raising living standards of its citizens, he added.

32.title: 59-yr-old trader attacked, robbed of ₹50 lakh cash in Chhattisgarh
32.article_body: A 59-year-old food grain trader was attacked and robbed of ₹50 lakh cash in Chhattisgarh's Raipur. The incident occurred on Monday night when the victim, identified as Narendra Khetrapal, was returning home on his scooter after closing his shop, police said. Khetrapal suffered head injuries in the attack, following which he was admitted to the hospital, police added.

33.title: Live-in couple found dead in rented flat in Gurugram's Sushant Lok
33.article_body: The Gurugram Police found bodies of a live-in couple, both aged 29 years, inside their rented apartment in Sushant Lok Phase 1 area. Police said that they found the man hanging and the woman lying on the bed in the same room. The man was a chef by profession and the woman worked at a food chain outlet in Gurugram.

34.title: Mike Tyson joins Sean Penn, Tye Sheridan in thriller 'Black Flies'
34.article_body: Former American boxer Mike Tyson is set to star in 'Black Flies', an upcoming thriller drama based on Shannon Burke's novel of the same name. He'll be seen sharing screen space with Sean Penn, Tye Sheridan and Katherine Waterston in the film, which will be directed by Jean-Stéphane Sauvaire. Tyson will also make a cameo appearance in Vijay Deverakonda's 'Liger'.

35.title: Tara Sharma, Koel Purie to play mothers to Agastya & Suhana in 'The Archies'
35.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda will be making their debut with Zoya Akhtar's film 'The Archies'. Actresses Koel Purie and Tara Sharma will play their mothers respectively. Tara had earlier made her debut in Anupam Kher's 'Om Jai Jagadish' as Abhishek Bachchan's wife, while Koel Purie starred in 'The Zoya Factor'.

36.title: Imran Khan's mobile phones stolen after recording video threat: Aide
36.article_body: Two mobile phones of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan were stolen after he claimed to have made a video clip containing names of all those allegedly plotting to assassinate him, a key aide of Khan said. However, the phones didn't contain Khan's video statement, Dr Shahbaz Gill added. Gill alleged that the phones were stolen at the Sialkot airport on Saturday.

37.title: Ratan Tata shares pics of fake FB page in his name, says 'will take legal action'
37.article_body: Ratan Tata took to Instagram to share screenshots of a fake Facebook page titled 'Ratan Tata Foundation'. He wrote, "This fraudulent page that has been scamming innocent citizens, using the names of my colleagues for money in exchange for help...We don't accept any funds in any form." He added that strict legal action will be taken against the page.

38.title: I resonate with Agni's violent nature & courage: Kangana on 'Dhaakad' role
38.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her character agent Agni in movie 'Dhaakad', said, "My character Agni is someone who works for...country, and I also love my country." "I'm an artist, and she's a spy. I resonate with her violent nature and courage...I'd have been a good IPS officer or armed forces officer. I've that kind of...fighting spirit in me," Kangana added.

39.title: I like to perform in crunch times: DC's Shardul Thakur on 4/36 vs PBKS
39.article_body: DC all-rounder Shardul Thakur, who was named Man of the Match for his performance against PBKS, has said he likes to perform during the "crunch times". He added, "The last two games were important and I always feel happy when I rise to the right occasion." Thakur registered figures of 4-0-36-4 in their match against PBKS.

40.title: As Delhi reels under heatwave, hospitals see spike in heat-related ailments
40.article_body: As Delhi is reeling under severe heatwave, hospitals in the national capital reported a noticeable spike in heat-related ailments. Doctors said these patients, who reported symptoms like dehydration, cramps, dizziness and fluctuations in blood pressure, mostly include women and senior citizens. People who stay out for longer durations are at greater risk of developing such symptoms, they added.

41.title: 54-yr-old man chasing phone thief gets hit by train, dies in MP
41.article_body: A 54-year-old man died in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol after being hit by a train while chasing a phone thief, police said on Tuesday. The deceased was travelling on a train when a person allegedly asked for his phone to make a call, an official said. Later, the person started running away with phone when the train slowed, the official added.

42.title: Probe Mamata Banerjee's nephew in coal theft case in Kolkata: SC to ED
42.article_body: Supreme Court has directed the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to probe West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and Trinamool Congress leader Abhishek Banerjee and his wife in the coal theft case in Kolkata instead of Delhi. SC added that it would not tolerate any kind of obstruction by the state machinery if ED interrogates Banerjee and his wife in Kolkata.

43.title: Woman found dead in Noida had filed rape complaint in U'khand: Police
43.article_body: A 47-year-old woman, found dead in Noida's Sector 137 on May 11, had lodged a rape complaint against one of her neighbours in Uttarakhand's Ranikhet, police said. The woman had been missing since May 9, police added. "On May 5, she boarded a bus to Ranikhet...On May 7, she went to a local police station...lodged an FIR," police stated.

44.title: 21-yr-old Kannada TV actress Chethana Raj dies after 'fat-free' plastic surgery in B'luru
44.article_body: Kannada TV actress Chethana Raj passed away after undergoing a 'fat-free' plastic surgery at a private hospital in Bengaluru. The 21-year-old actress faced post-surgery complications as fluid began to accumulate in her lungs. According to her father, she went for the surgery without informing them. Her parents have lodged a police complaint against the hospital authorities for negligence.

45.title: Viral video shows teachers teaching Hindi and Urdu at the same time in Bihar classroom
45.article_body: A viral video shows two teachers teaching Hindi and Urdu at the same time in a Bihar classroom. In the video, another teacher is seen trying to pacify the students by banging a stick on her desk. "Our school does not have enough classrooms and this is the reason we teach students in a single room," the Hindi teacher said.

46.title: Chinese PM tells Pak counterpart to punish Karachi blast culprits
46.article_body: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang on Monday asked Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif to ensure punishment for those responsible for the blast at Karachi University in which three Chinese teachers were killed. During a telephonic conversation, Keqiang told Sharif that China is shocked and outraged by the attack. Keqiang further called for enhanced security measures for Chinese institutions and citizens.

47.title: Appeal filed in SC against Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape
47.article_body: An appeal has been filed in Supreme Court against Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape. HC had heard petitions challenging the exception to IPC Section 375, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the offence of rape. One of the judges had held the exception unconstitutional while another had said it wasn't unconstitutional.

48.title: 'Jannat' was the best birthday gift I ever got: Sonal on 14 yrs of film
48.article_body: Sonal Chauhan, who made her debut in 2008 with 'Jannat', spoke about the film which completed 14 years of its release on Monday, on the occasion of her birthday. "Jannat was the best birthday gift I ever got...It coincidentally released on my birthday so yes, I'd say it was the most memorable birthday," she said, adding, "It'll always be...very special."

49.title: Doctor booked for blackmailing, raping tuition teacher in Lucknow
49.article_body: A well-known doctor in Lucknow has been booked for allegedly raping and blackmailing a tuition teacher. The teacher, who used to visit the doctor's place to provide tuition classes to his children, alleged that the accused morphed her photos, blackmailed her and sexually assaulted her for several months. He allegedly forced her to consume abortion pills when she became pregnant.

50.title: India's wholesale inflation surges to record 15.08% in April, up from 14.55% in Mar
50.article_body: India’s Wholesale Price Index (WPI) surged to a record high of 15.08% in April from 14.55% in March, according to the data released by the commerce ministry. As per the data released by the Centre on May 12, India’s retail inflation rose to 7.79% in April 2022, the highest since May 2014.

51.title: Hope India would reconsider its decision to ban wheat exports: US
51.article_body: US Ambassador to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield has said that the US hopes India would reconsider its decision to ban wheat exports. "We have seen the report of India's decision. We're encouraging countries not to restrict exports because we think any restrictions on exports will exacerbate the food shortages," she added. India is world's second-biggest wheat producer.

52.title: Process all Green Cards within 6 months: US presidential advisory commission
52.article_body: The President's Advisory Commission on Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians, and Pacific Islanders has unanimously voted to recommend US President Joe Biden to process all applications for Green Cards within six months. If adopted, it will benefit thousands of Indian-Americans and those waiting, some even for decades, for a Green Card. The recommendations now require White House's approval.

53.title: No cars sold in Shanghai in April due to COVID-19 restrictions
53.article_body: In China's Shanghai, home to 25 million residents, no cars were sold last month after dealerships were shut due to tight COVID-19 restrictions. It was the worst April sales' record in a decade, said the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers. China has imposed strict restrictions as it fights the largest COVID-19 outbreak in over two years.

54.title: Attempt to transform Gyanvapi mosque into temple is a conspiracy: AIMPLB
54.article_body: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) criticised the sealing of the pond (wazu khana) in the Gyanvapi Masjid complex and said, "Gyanvapi is a mosque and will remain a mosque." "The attempt to transform it into a temple is nothing more than a conspiracy to spread hate by communal forces," AIMPLB General Secretary Maulana Khalid Saifullah Rahmani said.

55.title: Saw bodies piled up, they had no way to leave: Official on Mundka fire
55.article_body: MK Chattopadhyay, a fire divisional officer at the Delhi Fire Service, said when fire fighters entered the building where fire broke out on May 13 near Mundka metro station, they saw that the goods were gutted and the chairs were hollow. "[We saw] bodies piled up near...door of...second floor...They had no way to leave...If only there was...second exit," he added.

56.title: IMD predicts moderate rainfall over Bengaluru for next 4 days
56.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted moderate rainfall over Bengaluru for the next four days. This comes after rainfall on Monday lashed the city leading to traffic jams and waterlogging in some parts. The IMD has also issued an 'orange' alert for Bengaluru for Tuesday and Wednesday, along with a 'yellow' alert for coastal areas of Karnataka for Tuesday.

57.title: Day after going missing, 25-yr-old banker found 'murdered' in Ludhiana
57.article_body: A 25-year-old banker was found "murdered" in Ludhiana’s Salaudi village on Monday, a day after he went missing. His body had multiple injuries. The victim’s father claimed that the "murder" was pre-planned. The police are suspecting an old rivalry as the motive behind the killing and the victim’s call history is also being scanned, a police official said.

58.title: Badi amma will be the epitome of brilliance: Sara on Sharmila's comeback film
58.article_body: Veteran actor Sharmila Tagore is set to make a comeback with 'Gulmohar'. Taking to Instagram Story, actress Sara Ali Khan shared the poster of the film and wrote a note for her grandmother. She said, "Badi amma is back on screen. To watch her, I am truly keen. She will be the epitome of brilliance and grace, I have yakeen."

59.title: McDonald's looking to sell its restaurants to a local buyer in Russia
59.article_body: McDonald's is looking to sell its restaurants to a local buyer in Russia after it announced its exit from the country after 30 years of operation. However, it won't allow stores to use its name, logo, branding and menu. It also said it would ensure its 62,000 employees in Russia continue to be paid until the closure of any transaction.

60.title: J&K police bust Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module in Bandipora; 7 held
60.article_body: At least seven people, including terrorists and their associates, were arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora after police busted a Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module, a police spokesperson said. Two of those arrested are hybrid terrorists who were tasked with carrying out attacks on security forces in the area, the spokesperson added. Incriminating material, arms and ammunition were also seized.

61.title: My parents are thrilled to be grandparents of 4 granddaughters: Nick Jonas
61.article_body: American singer-songwriter Nick Jonas, who is married to actress Priyanka Chopra, said that his parents are thrilled to be grandparents of four beautiful granddaughters. While talking about his newborn daughter Malti Marie, Nick said, "She's a gift and we're just so blessed." He added that the Jonas family keeps growing and there are a lot of girls.

62.title: Withdraw charges against doctors over kidney transplant malpractice: IMA Pune
62.article_body: Indian Medical Association's (IMA) Pune unit has sought the withdrawal of charges filed against Ruby Hall Clinic's doctors and management in kidney transplant malpractice case. "How can doctors be involved in checking...marriage documents once they're authorised by government agencies?" IMA Pune chief Meenakshi Deshpande said. A woman had allegedly posed as the wife of a man who needed transplant.

63.title: Police kill one more accused involved in killing of policemen in MP's Guna
63.article_body: One of the persons accused of killing three policemen in MP's Guna district last week was killed in an encounter on Tuesday morning. The encounter took place in a forest near Haripura village, police said. With this, three accused have so far been killed and four others arrested, police stated, adding that two of the accused are still absconding.

64.title: Situation in J&K improved due to synergy among forces: Lt Gen Dwivedi
64.article_body: Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi, GOC-in-C, Northern Command said due to an “extraordinary” synergy among security forces, the situation in J&K has seen “tremendous” improvement since August 2019. “There has been a considerable improvement in all parameters of terrorism and violence,” Lt Gen Dwivedi added. This has led to frustration among the terrorist leadership, he stated.

65.title: What led to baby formula shortage in US?
65.article_body: The baby formula shortage in the US can be traced back to a contamination problem at an Abbott factory that produces much of the Similac formula for the US market. Abbott voluntarily shut down the factory in February, amid consumer complaints. In addition to this, general supply-chain problems for the formula ingredients and packaging also led to the shortage.

66.title: Investors lose ₹42,500 crore within minutes of LIC listing at 9% discount
66.article_body: Investors lost over ₹42,500 crore in minutes on Tuesday after LIC's market capitalisation slipped to ₹5.57 lakh crore in early trade against over ₹6 lakh crore at the issue price. The stock was listed at ₹867 on the BSE, which is an 8.64% discount from its IPO price of ₹949. On NSE, it debuted at a discount of 8.11%.

67.title: G7's attempts to isolate Moscow make global food crisis worse: Russia
67.article_body: Russia said the attempts by the West, "primarily from the Group of Seven", to isolate Moscow have worsened global food shortages. G7 foreign ministers on Saturday had promised to reinforce Russia's economic, political isolation and work to ease food shortages stemming from Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Before war, Ukraine and Russia together accounted for about 29% of global wheat exports.

68.title: Uttar Pradesh on alert as dengue cases rise alarmingly
68.article_body: Health officials are on alert as dengue cases in Uttar Pradesh are rising. Though the state has required medical infrastructure to counter an outbreak, there's no medicine or vaccine for dengue, so efforts should be made to prevent it, health officials said. The state has 70 labs with dengue testing facilities and fever health desks at every hospital, they added.

69.title: Electric bus service at Pune's Sinhagad Fort suspended indefinitely
69.article_body: Pune administration indefinitely suspended its electric bus service at Sinhagad Fort from Tuesday. "The administration has been asked to suspend the special bus service from the foothill of Sinhagad Fort to the top till all issues related to safe travel are resolved," Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. The special bus service was launched on May 1.

70.title: Taliban dissolves Afghanistan's Human Rights Commission, calls it 'unnecessary'
70.article_body: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan dissolved five key departments, including the country's Human Rights Commission and the National Security Council, calling them "unnecessary". As Afghanistan faces a budget deficit of 44 billion Afghanis ($501 million) this financial year, Taliban authorities said, "These departments were not included in the budget and they have been dissolved."

71.title: Congress facing phobia of regional parties: HD Kumaraswamy
71.article_body: Reacting to Rahul Gandhi's remark that regional parties cannot fight the BJP-RSS as they lack ideology, ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that Congress is facing a "phobia of regional parties". "Congress has lost its identity in Andhra, Telangana, Odisha and other states. In Karnataka, the Congress is nearing its end," the Janata Dal (Secular) leader added.

72.title: Credit for our win vs PBKS goes to bowlers, they were outstanding: Marsh
72.article_body: DC's Mitchell Marsh said the credit for their win against PBKS goes to the bowlers as they were outstanding in restricting the Mayank Agarwal-led side to 142/9. "It's been one of those seasons where we've been stop-start. It's about peaking at the right time," he added. Marsh scored 63(48), while DC's Shardul Thakur took four wickets in the match.

73.title: 3 BJP workers booked for assaulting women NCP members in Pune
73.article_body: Pune Police has booked three BJP workers for allegedly assaulting women workers of Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) at a book-release event on Monday. As per FIR, the women had gone to the auditorium to give a memorandum to Union Minister Smriti Irani over rising inflation and LPG price hike issue. However, they alleged being assaulted and heckled by BJP workers.

74.title: He seemed like a real gentleman, was really nice: Heard on meeting Musk at Met Gala 2016
74.article_body: While testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, Amber Heard recalled the time when she appeared solo at Met Gala 2016 after Depp stood her up. She said she found herself standing next to Elon Musk. She added, "[Musk] was there with his mother...He reminded me we had met before...He seemed like a real gentleman. He was really nice."

75.title: LIC becomes 5th largest firm by m-cap after shares list at 9% discount
75.article_body: LIC has become the fifth-largest firm in the country by market capitalisation after it was listed at a 9% discount today. After listing, its market capitalisation rose to ₹5.70 lakh crore on BSE. In market capitalisation, ahead of LIC were Reliance Industries (₹16.74 lakh crore), TCS (₹12.38 lakh crore), HDFC Bank (₹7.23 lakh crore), Infosys (₹6.30 lakh crore) on BSE.

76.title: Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled after paper leak
76.article_body: A paper for the Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam has been cancelled after it was leaked, police said. Reports said the paper was leaked from an exam centre in Jhotwara before the second shift of exam on May 14. Police added that a case in connection with paper leak has been registered and that the exam will be conducted again.

77.title: Basmati seeds recalled by Karnal's IARI over poor germination complaints
77.article_body: The Indian Agricultural Research Institute's (IARI) regional centre in Karnal has recalled seeds of Pusa Basmati 1509 variety of rice it sold to farmers amid complaints of poor germination. Farmers of Punjab, Uttarakhand and UP had also purchased seeds from IARI's Karnal centre for early sowing. We will either replace the seeds or refund the money, an IARI scientist said.

78.title: Nearly 2 lakh people in 20 districts in Assam affected by floods: ASDMA
78.article_body: Around 1,97,248 people have been affected by the floods in 20 districts, the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. Hojai and Cachar are the worst hit with 78,157 and 51,357 people affected respectively, it added. At least two flood-related deaths were reported in the Cachar district and three casualties were earlier reported in Dima Hasao due to landslides.

79.title: Won't let Sweden, Finland join NATO: Turkey Prez
79.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has said he will not let Sweden and Finland join NATO over their stand on Kurdish militants. "These two countries lack a clear stance against terrorism," said Erdogan, adding, "Sweden is a nesting ground for terrorist organisations." He further said he will block countries that impose sanctions against Turkey from joining NATO.

80.title: Twitter shares fall by 8% after Musk suggests price cut for $44 bn Twitter deal
80.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that the Twitter acquisition deal at a lower price is "not out of the question", shares of Twitter fell by 8% to close at $37.39. The stocks fell below the $39.31 closing price on April 1, when Musk had revealed his Twitter stake. The Twitter deal is currently on hold over fake accounts data.

81.title: Imran Khan's security enhanced after 'assassination plot' claim
81.article_body: The security arrangements for former Pakistan PM Imran Khan have been enhanced after he claimed a threat to his life. "A conspiracy is afoot to take my life," Khan had said, adding he had recorded a video naming those involved in the conspiracy. Following this, PM Shehbaz Sharif directed officials to provide foolproof security to Khan.

82.title: 'The Kashmir Files' movie has triggered violence in J&K: Mehbooba Mufti
82.article_body: Amid protests against the targeted killing of the Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, Peoples Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti blamed Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' for triggering violence. "We created a safe atmosphere for Kashmiri Pandits. In 2016 during peak unrest, no killing happened. 'The Kashmir Files' movie has triggered violence," Mufti said.

83.title: Shivling claim unfair: AIMPLB on Gyanvapi Mosque case
83.article_body: Following claims of a Shivling being found in Varanasi’s Gyanvapi Mosque complex were reported, the All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) termed it as "unfair". "The attempt to declare it (mosque) a temple is nothing more than a conspiracy to create communal disharmony. It’s a matter of constitutional rights and is against the law," AIMPLB said in a statement.

84.title: Woman's family beats, parades man naked for 'texting her' in K'taka
84.article_body: A 20-year-old man was allegedly held captive, beaten and paraded naked in a village in Karnataka's Davanagere by a woman's family and some locals for "texting her", police said on Monday. This comes after purported videos of the incident, which occurred last week, surfaced online. The man's mother claimed in her complaint that he was held captive for two days.

85.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 77.73 against US dollar
85.article_body: The Indian rupee has touched a fresh all-time low of 77.73 against the US dollar as oil prices surged to near highest level in almost eight weeks. The rupee had ended at 77.45/dollar on Friday. Indian share markets are trading slightly higher with all eyes on the listing of state-run Life Insurance Corporation, the country's biggest IPO.

86.title: Daughter asked 'Mummy, is it cancer?', started crying: Chhavi on breast cancer
86.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer, said that she told her daughter that she is "very unwell" and she is going to fix the problem. "She knows about cancer as I had lost my nani to esophageal cancer...She turned around and said, 'Mummy, is it that?' I said, 'Yes'...she started crying," Chhavi added.

87.title: DC's total was definitely chaseable for the batting we have: Mayank
87.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said they lost "too many" wickets in the first 10 overs and that's why they lost their game against DC. "It was definitely chaseable for the batting we have and the wicket wasn't as bad as it seemed," he added. DC posted 159/7 and restricted PBKS to 142/9 to win their seventh game of IPL 2022.

88.title: Delhi man jailed for demolishing neighbour's wall using excavator
88.article_body: A man has been sentenced to 45 days imprisonment by Delhi High Court after he demolished his neighbour's boundary wall using a JCB excavator in violation of a court order. The incident occurred in Delhi's Burari over a property dispute. Holding him guilty of contempt and rejecting his apology, the court said the demolition was a wilful and deliberate act.

89.title: Biden reverses Trump's withdrawal of US troops from Somalia
89.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved the redeployment of US troops in Somalia, reversing a decision by his predecessor Donald Trump. The deployment was requested by US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin to "enable a more effective fight against al-Shabaab". The Pentagon said the troops wouldn't be directly fighting in combat operations, but working to train, advise and equip Somali forces.

90.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey report not ready yet, will seek 3-4 days from court: Official
90.article_body: The Gyanvapi mosque survey report is not complete yet and is only 50% ready, Assistant Court Commissioner Ajay Pratap Singh said on Tuesday. "We will not be able to produce the report before the court today. We will seek three-four days' time from Varanasi court," he added. "The survey lasted for three days from May 14-16," Singh further said.

91.title: WB Guv seeks report over police 'trespass' at BJP MLA's office
91.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar has sought a response from the state Chief Secretary over the alleged "criminal trespass" of state police and RAF at BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari's office-cum-residence in Nandigram. Adhikari had shared videos of the incident on May 15, claiming that the "'Mamata' police had barged" in without any prior intimation. Dhankhar called the incident "worrisome".

92.title: Passengers travelling in Mumbai AC locals increase by 4 times from Feb to May
92.article_body: The number of passengers travelling by AC locals in Mumbai has increased from a daily average of 5,939 in February to 26,815 in May till date. "The response to AC locals upped after the slashing of single journey ticket rates by 50% from May 5," a railway official said. CSMT, Dombivli are top two stations in terms of ticket sale.

93.title: Was at badminton court while growing up, there was no time for movies: Deepika
93.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said that her "growing up life" was very different from her friends from the industry. "I was at the badminton court and it was a very structured and disciplined life, in that sense. There was no time for movies," Deepika said, adding that she would watch only one or two movies in a year.

94.title: Telangana minister KTR slams PM Modi over his promise for ‘Achhe Din’
94.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao slammed Prime Minister Narendra Modi for not living up to his promise of 'Achhe Din' and said, "8 years ago...you had promised Achhe Din." "What your government has delivered - rupee at its lowest, highest unemployment in 45 years, highest inflation in 30 years, highest LPG price in...world, worst economy in 42 years," he added.

95.title: Would do anything to see you again: Ananya on grandmother's birth anniversary
95.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories to remember her late grandmother, Snehlata Panday, on her birth anniversary. Sharing an old picture of herself with her grandmother,  Ananya wrote, "Happy Birthday Dadi. I love and miss you so much. I would do anything to see you again." Ananya's grandmother passed away last year on July 10.

96.title: 'Gabbar Singh' director Harish working on a script for Salman: Report
96.article_body: Harish Shankar, director of films like 'Gabbar Singh' and 'Ramayya Vasthavayya', is reportedly writing a script for Salman Khan. "[He'll] discuss and pitch to him at the right time, in a right way when everything is finalised...Something big and interesting is on cards," the report said while quoting a source. Meanwhile, Salman is currently working on 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'.

97.title: Hit by wheat export ban, Madhya Pradesh traders call mandi strike
97.article_body: Affected by the ban on wheat export, the traders' associations in Madhya Pradesh have called for a two-day bandh of mandis during which they will not participate in auctioning process of wheat. A traders' association said the ban has badly hit them as around 4,000 trucks from the state are stuck outside Kandla and Mumbai ports for 10 days.

98.title: LIC shares get listed on stock exchanges, trade at ₹872 in pre-open trade
98.article_body: India's largest insurer Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) listed its shares on the stock exchanges on Tuesday. In pre-open, the shares settled at ₹872 per share on NSE against its issue price of ₹949 apiece. The ₹20,557-crore IPO had closed on May 9. The LIC IPO was India's largest to date and had closed with nearly 3 times subscriptions.

99.title: Mehmood & Mithun's portrayal in films were strange, look odd today: Siddharth
99.article_body: Actor Siddharth spoke about the way non-Hindi speaking characters were shown as "caricatures" in Hindi cinema. He said, "From the age of comedians, [we had] actors like Mehmood who made unrealistic and strange portrayals which were very popular at that time. But today, you feel odd watching them." "There was Mithun Chakraborty playing...Krishnan Iyer and selling coconut water," he added.

100.title: 35-yr-old man held for 'forcefully' marrying minor cousin in Telangana
100.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested in Telangana’s Ranga Reddy for "forcefully" marrying his 12-year-old cousin, police said. The minor girl was rescued and her parents’ role is being probed as they allegedly misled her into the marriage on the pretext of attending a family function, according to the police. The minor girl lodged a police complaint, a police official said.

101.title: CBI conducts searches at multiple locations of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram
101.article_body: The CBI is conducting searches at multiple locations of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram in connection with an ongoing case, his office told news agency ANI. The searches are reportedly being conducted at around seven premises. In March, a Delhi court granted regular bail to Karti and his father P Chidambaram in Aircel-Maxis cases filed by CBI and ED.

102.title: Deepika Padukone attends jury dinner at Cannes 2022, pics surface
102.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who's a part of the main jury at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, joined the other jury members for dinner at the Grand Hyatt Cannes Hotel Martinez on Monday evening. She attended the dinner along with actress-filmmaker Rebecca Hall as well as directors Asghar Farhadi and Joachim Trier. Several pictures of Deepika from the event have surfaced online.

103.title: Woman judge killed, 3 others injured as car collides with jeep in Raj
103.article_body: A woman judge, Saroj Chaudhary, died and three others were injured after her car collided head-on with Irrigation Department Assistant Engineer Shankar Lal's jeep on Bikaner-Khajuwala highway in Rajasthan. Reports said that Saroj, who was in the back seat of the car, was bleeding profusely when she was taken to the hospital. The doctors then declared her dead.

104.title: Sharjeel Imam moves HC seeking bail after SC puts sedition on hold
104.article_body: JNU student leader Sharjeel Imam has moved Delhi High Court seeking bail after the Supreme Court recently ordered the sedition law to be put on hold. Imam has been booked under IPC Section 124A for allegedly giving inflammatory speeches during the anti-CAA protests. A two-judge bench is scheduled to hear the plea on May 17.

105.title: Pant shouldn't have fallen into PBKS' trap: RP Singh
105.article_body: Ex-India cricketer RP Singh has criticised DC captain Rishabh Pant for his batting approach during their match against PBKS. "Pant shouldn't have fallen into the trap...He had hit a six, another big shot was not needed...The team management also has to think about how Pant has to approach his innings," stated Singh. Pant was dismissed after scoring 7(3).

106.title: We're all commie as f***: Twitter's senior engineer in a leaked recording
106.article_body: In a leaked video recording, a senior engineer at Twitter was heard saying, "We're all commie as f***" while speaking in reference to how differently the company functions from Tesla CEO Elon Musk's firms. Siru Murugesan said, "He's a capitalist and we weren't really operating as capitalists, more like very socialist." He claimed employees tried to revolt against Musk's takeover.

107.title: Hyderabad Police arrests 8 for selling plots using fake documents
107.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Sunday arrested eight people for allegedly forging documents and selling plots illegally. The case came to light after the complainant informed the police that the accused had forged property documents in the name of her husband who was dead. The accused persons then transferred the property to themselves and sold it for ₹6 crore, police said.

108.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her intimate wedding to Travis Barker
108.article_body: American media personality Kourtney Kardashian took to Instagram to confirm getting married to musician Travis Barker. Sharing pictures from their intimate wedding, Kourtney wrote, "Till death do us part." Commenting on her post, Kim Kardashian wrote, "Kravis forever." The duo had got engaged in October 2021 after having made their relationship official on Instagram in February last year.

109.title: India reports 1,569 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 16,400
109.article_body: India has reported 1,569 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,202 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 16,400, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,260, according to the latest data.

110.title: It was Kohli's chance to win IPL, bowling that 1 over shattered me: Watson on 2016 final
110.article_body: Talking about the IPL 2016 final, wherein he conceded 24 runs off SRH's last over, Shane Watson said, "Bowling that one over just shattered me." He added, "RCB had played so well all year...Kohli, in particular, was on fire. It was his chance, one of the greatest players, to win that elusive IPL title as captain."

111.title: Ukraine evacuates troops from last holdout in besieged Mariupol city
111.article_body: More than 260 Ukrainian soldiers were evacuated from Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, Ukraine's last stronghold in the port city, after weeks of resistance against the Russian invasion. All the evacuees, including 53 badly wounded troops, were taken to areas under Russia’s control. They will be subject to a potential prisoner exchange with Russia, Ukraine's Deputy Defence Minister Anna Malyar said.

112.title: Curfew in MP's Neemuch over clashes after Lord Hanuman idol placed near dargah
112.article_body: Clashes broke out between two communities on Monday after some people placed an idol of Lord Hanuman near a dargah in the old Kachari area in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch, police said. The district administration imposed prohibitory orders under section 144 following the clashes. "During the clashes, some persons pelted stones damaging three-four motorcycles but no persons were injured," police added.

113.title: Twitter doesn't believe in free speech: Senior engineer in leaked recording
113.article_body: A senior engineer at Twitter has said the company "doesn't believe in free speech" and the employees "hated" Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s $44 billion takeover bid. An American activist group Project Veritas released a recording of Siru Murugesan's remarks. Murugesan said Twitter's office politics were quite left-leaning and the staff had to change their original views to adjust to it.

114.title: The only process was to take it deep: Pant on 17-run win vs PBKS
114.article_body: After DC defeated PBKS to register their second straight win, captain Rishabh Pant said he wanted to change the pattern of "losing one and winning one game". Talking about the match, Pant said, "The only process was to take it deep, with spinners getting help." He added, "[We'll] assess the wicket and see how [the next game] goes."

115.title: 21-yr-old man held for making derogatory video against Hindu deities in UP
115.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested for making a video in which he allegedly made derogatory remarks against Hindu deities, police said. The accused man, Umar Abdullah, purportedly posted an "inappropriate" video on social media. The incident was reported on May 14 and the accused was arrested on Monday after the police were tipped off about his presence in his locality.

116.title: Bengaluru reports less than 100 COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 1.05%
116.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 89 new COVID-19 cases, as compared to 118 new cases reported on Sunday. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), zero deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, while 131 people recovered from the virus during the same period. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 1.05%, the data showed.

117.title: 40-yr-old illegal market demolished in Mohali by GMADA, 4 acres freed
117.article_body: The Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (GMADA) on Monday carried out a demolition drive at the 40-year-old Shaheed Bhagat Singh Market in Phase-1, reclaiming around four acres of government land. Around 50 illegal temporary shops had come up at the market, officials said. The shopkeepers raised slogans to protest against the drive that continued from 12 pm to 3:30 pm.

118.title: Despite raid at dad's house, Madhuri shot for comedy scene: Rajkumar Santoshi
118.article_body: Filmmaker Rajkumar Santoshi said that once when he was shooting with actress Madhuri Dixit in Ooty, she shot for a comedy scene despite her father's house being raided in Mumbai at the same time. "She didn't let the director know...she was under stress and had to reach Mumbai...didn't let the director know...there was stress in her personal life," Santoshi added.

119.title: IISc B'lore develops tooth-cleaning nanobots for dental treatment
119.article_body: Researchers at Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore have developed nano-sized robots that can kill bacteria deep inside dentinal tubules and improve the success rate of root canal treatments. According to researchers, the existing techniques aren't efficient enough to go deep and kill the bacteria. They said the new technique allows nanobots to penetrate deep and clean the infection.

120.title: Over 100 Ghaziabad high-rises lack firefighting systems: Officials
120.article_body: Officials of Ghaziabad district's fire department said that they have inspected 113 residential high-rise buildings which lacked firefighting measures and have failed to adhere to fire safety norms. As per official records, Ghaziabad witnessed 3,177 fire incidents from January 2019 to March 2022. "We checked about 202 hospitals and only 42 of them had firefighting systems," an official said.

121.title: Thought I shouldn't be destroying what Rishi had done: Paresh on 'Sharmaji...'
121.article_body: Paresh Rawal spoke about the challenge of completing late actor Rishi Kapoor's 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. He said, "The challenge for me was what Rishi saab had done, I shouldn't be destroying that. Whatever he has sawed, without vandalising that, I need to carry it forward in a subtle way." "It was a relay race that I had to complete," he added.

122.title: BBMP identifies 9,500 potholes to fix in Bengaluru
122.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has identified around 9,500 potholes in Bengaluru which it said will be fixed in a continuous exercise. "This is not the final number as the procedure has just been started and the data is only two to three days old," BBMP official said. The civic body will use FixMyStreet app to identify more potholes.

123.title: 20-yr-old woman raped at knifepoint in Mumbai, video filmed; 2 arrested
123.article_body: Police have arrested two brothers for allegedly raping a 20-year-old woman at knifepoint in Mumbai. Reports said that while one of them raped her, other filmed video and threatened to circulate it if she spoke about incident to anyone. Police said that accused entered her house in broad daylight and raped woman who had come to Mumbai two months ago.

124.title: 18-yr-old girl gives birth in Pune; parents booked for marrying her as minor
124.article_body: After an 18-year-old girl gave birth to a baby at Pune's Sassoon General Hospital recently, a case has been filed against her parents, husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law for allegedly getting her married when she was a minor. A police sub-inspector said that the girl had turned 18 this year in February. "No arrest has been made yet," the sub-inspector added.

125.title: upGrad launches Doctorate programs from global universities
125.article_body: upGrad has partnered with Golden Gate University, San Francisco and Swiss School of Business & Management, Geneva to offer Online DBA Programs for working professionals. Professionals with 5+ years of experience can now add a Doctor's title to their list of achievements by pursuing a thesis in their area of expertise, with 1:1 supervision from international faculty in 3 years.

126.title: 16-year-old boy killed as tempo hits two-wheeler in Pune
126.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was killed after a tempo first hit a hoarding, then rammed into a shed built in front of a butcher shop and then hit two two-wheeler vehicles in Pune's Dhankawadi, police said. The deceased teenager was sitting on one of the two two-wheelers, police added. The driver was driving the tempo without a permit, police further said.

127.title: Greek man gets life sentence for killing British wife in front of kid
127.article_body: A Greek pilot was sentenced to life in prison for killing his 20-year-old wife in front of their 11-month-old child last year. Babis Anagnostopoulos had initially claimed that thieves broke into their house and killed his wife and dog. Following evidence from CCTV cameras at their home and a smartwatch worn by his wife, the 34-year-old confessed to the murder.

128.title: Johnny Depp slapped me, squeezed my neck against railway car during honeymoon: Heard
128.article_body: While testifying in her ex-husband Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, actress Amber Heard claimed that Depp hit her during their honeymoon. "Johnny slapped me across the face...He squeezed my neck against the railway car for what felt like a very long time." She added, "At some point he ripped his shirt off, and wrapped it around my neck."

129.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as DC enter top 4?
129.article_body: With their 17-run victory over PBKS, DC moved to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC are fourth with 14 points and a net run-rate (NRR) of 0.255. Meanwhile, RCB are now fifth on the points table with 14 points and NRR of -0.323. KKR and PBKS are sixth and seventh, respectively.

130.title: T'gana owes GHMC ₹5,500 crore in property taxes as of April: Report
130.article_body: Telangana government and its undertakings owe Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation  (GHMC) over ₹5,500 crore in property taxes as of April, The Indian Express reported, citing an RTI response. In response to the RTI, the GHMC commissioner reportedly said that they've been regularly issuing notices for the payments. Some of the taxes have been pending for 25 years, the report said.

131.title: 5 feared drowned in Yamuna while escaping attack by rival group in Haryana
131.article_body: At least five men were feared drowned in Yamuna while escaping an attack by nearly 20 men of a rival group in Haryana's Yamunanagar, police said. They reportedly jumped into the water to save their lives. An NDRF team on Monday recovered three bodies. "The incident is said to be a fallout of multiple clashes between the groups," police added.

132.title: Twitter deal at a lower price is not out of the question, says Musk
132.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that the Twitter acquisition deal being viable at a lower cost is "not out of the question". Speaking at a conference, Musk said, "You can't pay the same price for something that is much worse than they claimed." He also said, "The more questions I ask, the more my concerns grow."

133.title: 207 bodies lying unclaimed in 10 Mumbai mortuaries since Feb 2021: Report
133.article_body: At least 207 bodies have been lying unclaimed in 10 mortuaries of civic and police surgeon-run hospitals across Mumbai since February 2021, a report said. According to the police manual, unclaimed bodies should be disposed within seven to 30 days. Officials said the unclaimed bodies that are usually of the victims of railway or road accidents are rarely identified.

134.title: Elisabeth Borne to become France's 1st female Prime Minister in 30 years
134.article_body: France's President Emmanuel Macron has appointed Labour Minister Elisabeth Borne as the country's new PM, the first woman to hold the position in three decades. This comes after Prime Minister Jean Castex submitted his resignation. During Borne's tenure as Labour Minister, unemployment fell to its lowest level in 15 years and youth unemployment to its lowest level in 40 years.

135.title: We suspend over half a million spam accounts every day: Twitter CEO
135.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal shared an extensive Twitter thread on spam accounts amid its acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk being put on hold. Parag tweeted, "We suspend over half a million spam accounts every day, usually before any of you even see them on Twitter. We...lock millions of accounts each week that we suspect may be spam."

136.title: Twitter CEO posts long thread on spam accounts, Musk replies with poop emoji
136.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Monday tweeted a long thread on spam accounts amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s proposed acquisition being put on hold over fake accounts data. Speaking about Musk’s plan to identify bots, Parag said “We don't believe that this specific estimation can be performed externally”. In reply to this, Musk tweeted a poop emoji.

137.title: Mumbai auto unions to protest on May 17 demanding CNG price reduction
137.article_body: Auto-rickshaw unions in Mumbai will go on a day-long protest outside Mahanagar Gas Limited office in Bandra Kurla Complex on May 17 demanding a reduction in CNG prices. Auto-rickshaw unions are also demanding a ₹2 hike in base fare. "We expect around 5,000 drivers to turn up for the protest," said Mumbai Auto Rickshaw Taximen's Union President Shashank Rao.

138.title: 2 Mumbai homebuyers to get 7 times the price of undelivered flats
138.article_body: About 27 years after they booked flats in City Builders' City Embassy project in Kopar Khairane in Navi Mumbai, Gul Achra and Kanta Achra will receive ₹91 lakh and ₹88 lakh respectively as the builder failed to complete the project. While Gul had booked a flat worth ₹12.56 lakh in November 1995, Kanta had booked another flat for ₹13.16 lakh.

139.title: DC defeat PBKS by 17 runs, move to 4th position on IPL 2022 points table
139.article_body: DC defeated PBKS by 17 runs at the DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai to move to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC and RCB now have 14 points each, with DC having a superior net run-rate (NRR). Mitchell Marsh top-scored for DC with 63(48), while DC fast bowler Shardul Thakur took four wickets in the match.

140.title: He has some superpowers, is GOAT in tennis right now: Swiatek on Nadal
140.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek praised Rafael Nadal, saying he's the "perfect role model" and the "Greatest of All Time" (GOAT) in tennis right now. Recalling Nadal's 2022 Australian Open victory when he came back from two sets down against Daniil Medvedev, Swiatek said he has some superpowers, just never gives up, physically, tactically, he's always there on the court.

141.title: Thomas Cup winners Satwiksairaj-Chirag pull out of Thailand Open
141.article_body: Thomas Cup 2022 winning duo Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty have pulled out of the Thailand Open Super 500 tournament, beginning Tuesday, in Bangkok. It is, reportedly, learnt that Chirag suffered some niggles during the tournament and the pair decided to withdraw. The world number eight pair had lost just one match in India's first-ever Thomas Cup title-winning campaign.

142.title: Uber launches robot-assisted food delivery service in 2 US cities
142.article_body: Uber on Monday said it has launched pilot food delivery services with autonomous vehicles in two cities in US' California. It announced one food delivery service using autonomous cars and a separate pilot using sidewalk robots. Both services are available to users in Santa Monica and West Hollywood and can be opted out of.

143.title: SEBI bans Urja Global, 4 people from securities market for 2 years
143.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has banned energy provider and operator, Urja Global, and four individuals from dealing in the securities market for two years. It found that Urja Global made a false and misleading scheme for a corporate announcement in connection with Nippon Shinyaku. Various other disclosure lapses were also observed.

144.title: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara jailed for 8 yrs for sexually abusing 13-yr-old girl
144.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara Phythian has been jailed for sexually abusing a girl who was aged between 13 and 15 years. The 38-year-old's husband Victor Marke (59) has been jailed for 14 years for abusing the same victim and for the indecent assault of another girl. They were found guilty of 14 counts of sexual activity with a child.

145.title: Sri Lanka plans to privatise national airline to help pay off debt
145.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday proposed privatising national airline Sri Lankan Airlines as part of reforms aimed at paying off the economic crisis-hit country's debts. "It shouldn't be that this loss has to be borne by the poorest of the poor," Wickremesinghe said. He added that the airline made a loss of SLR 45 billion in FY21.

146.title: Fire breaks out at shoe factory in Delhi, 9 fire tenders rushed to spot
146.article_body: A fire broke out at a footwear factory in Delhi's Narela industrial area on Monday, Delhi Fire Service officials said. Nine fire tenders have been rushed to the spot, officials added. So far, no casualty has been reported in the incident. The fire was reportedly brought under control and 10 workers were evacuated safely.

147.title: They want to muddy the topic: Jeff Bezos on US govt criticising his recent tweets
147.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos tweeted, "They understandably want to muddy the topic," on the White House's statement about his tweets opposing taxing the rich corporations to tame inflation. It accused Bezos of opposing an "economic agenda for the middle class that cuts some of the biggest costs families face". Earlier, Bezos accused US President Joe Biden of "misdirection" over inflation.

148.title: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan to make his acting debut soon: Report
148.article_body: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan will reportedly make his acting debut in a film. "The makers felt that Shikhar suits the character and reached out to him a few months back," a source close to the development was quoted by Pinkvilla. "It's a proper full-length role and is not a cameo. His part is pivotal to the film," the source added.

149.title: Punjab witnessing complete breakdown of law and order: SAD's Badal
149.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) President Sukhbir Singh Badal on Monday said Punjab is witnessing a complete breakdown of law and order. "Instead of providing relief to the common man, CM Bhagwant Mann is holding phony photo-ops...If this is the badlav (change) that AAP promised, then Punjabis are in for one of the worst phases in the state's history," Badal added.

150.title: Akash Madhwal replaces Suryakumar Yadav in Mumbai Indians squad
150.article_body: Mumbai Indians have signed Akash Madhwal as a replacement for Suryakumar Yadav, who was ruled out of IPL 2022 owing to a left forearm muscle injury. Madhwal is a right-arm medium-fast bowler and has represented Uttarakhand across all three formats of the game since making his domestic debut in 2019. He was a part of MI's support team.

151.title: Nadal is my biggest opponent between him and Federer: Djokovic
151.article_body: Acknowledging his rivalry with Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal, world number one Novak Djokovic said that 21-time Grand Slam champion Nadal is the biggest opponent of his career. "I have grown as a player because he [Nadal] has pushed me to it," he added. Djokovic leads Federer 27-23 and Nadal 30-28 in head-to-head on the ATP Tour.

152.title: Insulting: Mishra as IAS officer jokingly credits India's Thomas Cup win to mosquito racquet
152.article_body: Veteran cricketer Amit Mishra reacted to IAS officer Somesh Upadhyay jokingly crediting India's Thomas Cup win to a mosquito racquet. Somesh shared a picture of a mosquito racquet and wrote, "Indonesian are surprised how Indians got better at badminton than them." Mishra responded, "This is not only distasteful but also insulting the achievement of our badminton heroes."

153.title: DC opener Shaw should make a comeback when he's 100% fit: Nikhil
153.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra has said DC opener Prithvi Shaw, who was admitted to hospital due to typhoid a few days back, should make a comeback in the team in ongoing IPL if he's feeling 100% fit. He added that if Shaw plays without proper practice sessions, the team will lose him for playoffs if they qualify for the same.

154.title: Pics of Bajrang Dal arms training in K'taka trigger probe, 'used air guns', says Dal
154.article_body: Pictures of a week-long Bajrang Dal arms training camp in Karnataka went viral online, following which the police said that an investigation is being done. The camp with 116 participants was organised in Kodagu and weapons like Trishuls (tridents) were distributed among them. Bajrang Dal, however, said that only air guns were used and the Trishuls distributed 'weren't sharp'.

155.title: 34-yr-old man rapes 11-yr-old girl who ran away from home in Maha
155.article_body: The Vasai police in Maharashtra arrested a 34-year-old man on Sunday for allegedly kidnapping and raping an 11-year-old girl who had gone missing on Saturday, officers said. She took a local train to Mumbai before deciding on returning home. However, she met the accused who raped her before leaving the girl on the road, police said.

156.title: Govt puts Pawan Hans sale on hold over concerns about winning bidder
156.article_body: The Centre has decided to put on hold the sale of its 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited to Star9 Mobility. The decision was taken after concerns were raised over Almas Global Opportunity Fund, one of the majority stakeholders of Star9 Mobility. NCLT had sanctioned Almas Global over its failure to pay after successfully bidding to acquire Kolkata-based EMC Limited.

157.title: Shailesh Lodha to quit 'Taarak Mehta Ka...' after 14 yrs: Report
157.article_body: Actor Shailesh Lodha, who plays the role of Taarak Mehta in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', will reportedly be quitting the show after almost 14 years. As per a report by ETimes, Shailesh has not shot for the show since the last month and won't return to the show as he is not happy with his current contract.

158.title: Punjab CM Mann launches 'Lok Milni' for grievance redressal of people
158.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann heard the grievances of the people and issued directions for their redressal in a public interaction programme, 'Lok Milni', which was launched on Monday. "This is a humble step of my government to make sure that we facilitate resolution of long-pending administrative issues concerning people," he said.

159.title: Maintain peace, don't disturb environment: Lekhi to Mufti, Owaisi
159.article_body: Union Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi on Monday told AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti to "maintain peace and brotherhood" and "not disturb the environment". This came after Mufti and Owaisi commented on the Varanasi Court's order to seal the place of the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling was found.

160.title: B'luru Police chief Kamal Pant transferred, CH Pratap Reddy to replace him
160.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday transferred Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant with immediate effect. CH Pratap Reddy, who held the post of Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, will replace him until further orders. Pant has been transferred to the post of Director General of Police, Recruitment.

161.title: Entire world is watching, be sensible as a leader: Shami to Hardik
161.article_body: Revealing what advice he gave to GT skipper Hardik Pandya, teammate Mohammad Shami said he told him to control his emotions on the field "because the entire world watches cricket." He added that it's important to be sensible as a leader and he has witnessed a lot of changes in Hardik as a captain in comparison to a player.

162.title: Chlorine gas leaks during water tank demolition in WB, 15 fall ill
162.article_body: Fifteen people fell ill in West Bengal's Murshidabad after chlorine gas leaked during the demolition of an old water tank reservoir in the district's Public Health Engineering Department. A fire official said the incident took place after JCB machines at work "broke the reservoir by mistake". Two patients, who were severely ill, were shifted to a hospital in Berhampur.

163.title: Artistes can succeed only by keeping regional feelings aside: Nagarjuna
163.article_body: Nagarjuna, while hosting 'Bigg Boss Telugu Non-Stop', criticised contestant Nataraj who asked viewers to not vote for co-contestant Bindu as she's from Chennai, adding he'll entertain the audience as he's part of the Telugu industry. Nagarjuna told Natarajan artistes can succeed when they keep their regional feelings aside. "90% film industry was in Chennai before the states split," he added.

164.title: India overtakes Germany as 4th largest vehicle market: Report
164.article_body: India surpassed Germany to become the world's fourth largest automotive market in 2021, data by the Organisation Internationale des Constructeurs d'Automobiles (OICA) showed. As per the data, India saw 3,759,398 vehicles sold in 2021, compared to 2,973,319 vehicles in Germany. The most number of vehicles were sold in China, followed by the US and Japan.

165.title: Warner changes end at last second to face Livingstone, gets out on 1st ball; video viral
165.article_body: DC opener David Warner changed his end at the last second to face PBKS Liam Livingstone on the first ball of his team's innings and got out on the first ball. DC's Sarfaraz Khan was ready to face the first ball, however, Warner decided to take strike after knowing Livingstone was bowling the first over.

166.title: No shivling found, there's only a fountain: Gyanvapi Mosque Committee's lawyer
166.article_body: Rais Ahmad Ansari, an advocate of the Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee that manages the Gyanvapi Mosque, has called petitioners' claim about a 'Shivling' being found at the mosque "misleading". "There's only a fountain in the mosque's wazu khana," Ansari said. His statement came after a court in UP's Varanasi ordered the sealing of the spot where 'Shivling' was reportedly found.

167.title: Elon Musk considers visit to Indonesia over possible investments
167.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is considering a visit to Indonesia to explore investment opportunities. As per Indonesian President Joko Widodo's office, Musk said to Widodo, "Hopefully in November...thank you for the invitation," after the two met in Texas on Saturday. Indonesia, which has some of the largest nickel deposits, has been in talks with Musk's team over electric vehicles development.

168.title: Don't remember last OTT show I was excited about: Abhishek Banerjee
168.article_body: Abhishek Banerjee, speaking about the OTT platforms, has said, "There is a saturation which is definitely going to come in." "I don't remember the last show which I was excited about...also the kind of shows which come your way, you don't see the excitement level which we saw probably in projects we've done," he added. Abhishek starred in 'Paatal Lok'.

169.title: No merit: Aditya Birla Capital on report claiming corruption caused CEO's exit
169.article_body: Aditya Birla Capital (ABC) on Monday said outgoing CEO Ajay Srinivasan is transitioning to a new role being crafted at the group level. This comes after a news report, citing a whistleblower letter, alleged that Srinivasan was asked to leave due to corruption, insider trading and front running. "These insinuations/allegations are bereft of facts," said the ABC spokesperson.

170.title: Fire breaks out at shelters for Central Vista project workers, no casualties
170.article_body: A fire broke out in three temporary shelters for workers involved in the Central Vista project near Parliament House in central Delhi on Monday, officials said. No casualties were reported in the incident, they said, adding that mattresses and household items were destroyed in the fire. Five fire tenders reached the spot and doused the blaze within an hour.

171.title: Unwarranted comments: India on Islamic nations' remarks on J&K delimitation
171.article_body: India on Monday criticised the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC), calling its comments on the delimitation exercise in Jammu and Kashmir "unwarranted". "OIC should refrain from carrying out its communal agenda vis-a-vis India at the behest of one country," said the External Affairs Ministry. The 57-member OIC had criticised India over the delimitation exercise during a meeting in Pakistan.

172.title: China building infrastructure near Arunachal border: Indian Army
172.article_body: Indian Army's General Officer Commanding-in chief of the Eastern command Lieutenant General RP Kalita on Monday said China's People's Liberation Army is engaged in infrastructure capacity enhancement across the international border in Arunachal Pradesh. Border villages built by Chinese authorities can be used for dual purposes, he said. "We are continuously monitoring the situation," he added.

173.title: Rahul’s comments on regional parties bizarre, out of sync: RJD
173.article_body: Responding to Rahul Gandhi's comments on regional parties, Rashtriya Janata Dal on Monday said that his comments were bizarre and out of sync with Congress' own declaration. In his address at his party's 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur, Gandhi had claimed that regional parties cannot fight the BJP-RSS as they lack ideology. Congress can fight it, he said.

174.title: Fearless Arshdeep flourishes under pressure situations for PBKS: Harbhajan
174.article_body: Calling Arshdeep Singh a "fearless bowler" with a "lion's heart", ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said the PBKS pacer has the quality to flourish in the pressure situations in ongoing IPL.
