"There's so much confidence in this bowler and the belief that he can do well during tense moments...he bowls yorkers at will in the death overs," he added.

175.title: BCCI announce squads for 2022 Women's T20 Challenge
175.article_body: The BCCI have announced squads for the 2022 Women's T20 Challenge. Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana and Deepti Sharma have been named captains of Supernovas, Trailblazers and Velocity, respectively. The Women's T20 Challenge will begin with the Trailblazers taking on Supernovas in the opening game on May 23. The final will take place on May 28.

176.title: Wife forcing husband to separate from parents amounts to mental cruelty: HC
176.article_body: If a wife continuously insists that her husband separate from his parents and threatens to implicate him in a false dowry demand case, it would amount to mental cruelty, the Chhattisgarh HC ruled. It said this while hearing a man's petition challenging the order of a family court, which had rejected his plea to seek divorce on grounds of cruelty.

177.title: Muslims not ready to lose another mosque after Babri Masjid: Owaisi
177.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that Muslims aren't ready to lose another mosque after Babri Masjid, following the Varanasi Court order to seal the place in the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling was found. "This is a textbook repeat of December 1949 in Babri Masjid. This order itself changes the religious nature of the masjid," he said.

178.title: I won't lie, next couple of months to be most difficult ones: Sri Lanka PM to citizens
178.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday warned the economic crisis-hit country's citizens, "The next couple of months will be the most difficult ones of our lives." He added, "I have no desire to hide the truth and to lie to the public." He said Sri Lanka's budget deficit stands at SLR 2.4 trillion (13% of the country's GDP).

179.title: Tamil Nadu CM writes to PM Modi over rising prices of cotton, yarn
179.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking his immediate intervention to solve the "serious disruptions" faced by the textile industry in the state. Stalin said despite the Union government withdrawing import duty levied on cotton, the prices of cotton and yarn have been continuously on the rise.

180.title: Anjali & I being close in 'Lock Upp' wasn't easy for Nazila: Munawar
180.article_body: 'Lock Upp' season 1 winner Munawar Faruqui has revealed that his closeness with co-contestant Anjali Arora on the show was not easy for his girlfriend Nazila Sitaishi. "Nazila went through a lot of emotions, but in the end, she understood the game and supported me," he stated. Munawar added that Nazila had "complete trust" in him.

181.title: Sri Lanka left with only one day of petrol stock, warns new PM
181.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe in an address to the nation on Monday said, "At the moment, we only have petrol stocks for a single day." He said the crisis-hit country urgently needed $75 million in foreign exchange to pay for essential imports. "The next couple of months will be the most difficult ones of our lives," he added.

182.title: 4 killed as rains trigger landslides in Arunachal, 1 still trapped
182.article_body: Four persons were killed in landslides triggered by incessant rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar, police said. Itanagar SP Jimmy Chiram said a woman is still trapped under debris after a house collapsed due to the impact of a landslide, killing two people. "Rescue operations are going on to evacuate her," Chiram added. Three other persons sustained injuries in the incident.

183.title: I still hear screams & people begging for help: Mundka fire survivor
183.article_body: One of the survivors of the Mundka fire incident, Mamata, recounted her escape and said, "It is like a video continuously playing in my head. I still hear screams and people begging for help." The 45-year-old, who is a resident of Parvesh Nagar in Delhi, said she could still feel the smoke. Mamata suffered injuries on her hands and foot.

184.title: Felt really nice speaking to PM Modi after Thomas Cup win: Srikanth
184.article_body: India's badminton player Kidambi Srikanth has said that the Indian badminton team's first-ever Thomas Cup win is a victory for every Indian. Talking about speaking to PM Narendra Modi after winning the tournament, Srikanth said, "I...didn't expect that...It felt...nice speaking to him immediately after the match." He added PM Modi keeping a track of players and their performances is "amazing".

185.title: People of Nepal equally happy over building of Ram Temple: PM Modi
185.article_body: PM Narendra Modi during his visit to Nepal on Monday, said people of Nepal are as happy as Indians over building of a grand Lord Ram Temple in India. "In Janakpur, I'd said that 'Our Ram is also incomplete without Nepal'," he added. He said his birthplace in Gujarat's Vadnagar was also a great centre of Buddhist learning, centuries ago.

186.title: Felt that season didn't really start for us till first win: MI's David
186.article_body: Speaking about bottom-placed MI's form in IPL 2022, MI batter Tim David stated the season didn't start for them until they won their first match following eight consecutive losses. "Since then, we've played some really good cricket," he added. "We've won three of our last four games and there has been a good feeling in the team," David further said.

187.title: I'd rate myself as one of the favourites at 2022 French Open: Djokovic
187.article_body: Talking about his chances of winning the title at upcoming French Open, Novak Djokovic said he would rate himself as one of the favourites following his form in the last few weeks. The world number one won his first title of 2022 in Rome on Sunday. Before this, Djokovic lost in Serbia Open final and in semi-final in Madrid Open.

188.title: Adani offers to buy 26% of Ambuja, ACC for $6.5 bn after $10.5 bn Holcim deal
188.article_body: Gautam Adani has made an open offer to acquire a 26% stake each in Ambuja Cements and ACC from public shareholders for $6.5 billion. A day ago, Adani announced a $10.5 billion deal to acquire Holcim's India business. Notably, Holcim holds 63.19% in Ambuja Cements and 54.53% in ACC (of which 50.05% is held through Ambuja Cements).

189.title: Bharti accused of insulting Sikhs as her video mocking beards goes viral, apologises
189.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh has been accused of hurting the sentiments of the Sikh community in an old video where she's heard mocking beards and moustaches. Following the backlash, Singh issued a video statement saying, "I haven't mentioned any religion or caste in the video...But if people from any religion...have been hurt...I apologise to them with folded hands."

190.title: Global wheat prices hit record high after India bans export
190.article_body: After India banned wheat exports earlier this week, wheat prices touched a new record high of €435 ($453) per tonne as the Euronext market opened on Monday. The prices had reached the previous record high of €422 on Friday, as supplies from Russia and Ukraine (both major wheat exporters) have been disrupted. Wheat futures traded in Chicago also rose 5.9%.

191.title: Russell is one of the guys who can do special things: KKR's Southee
191.article_body: KKR pacer Tim Southee has said that his teammate and all-rounder Andre Russell is having a "tremendous" IPL 2022. "There are a few guys around the world that can do special things and Andre Russell's one of those guys," he further added. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Russell has scored 330 runs and has taken 17 wickets in 13 matches.

192.title: World's second-largest economy China's retail sales fall to lowest in over 2 years
192.article_body: Retail sales of the world's second-largest economy, China, slumped to its lowest in over two years while factory output plunged, official data showed. It's the biggest slump since March 2020 as Chinese consumers remained mostly at home amid coronavirus restrictions. This also comes amid China and its business hub Shanghai adhering to strict coronavirus measures, negatively affecting supply chains.

193.title: IAS officer accused in ₹18cr fraud in J'khand sent to 4-day ED remand
193.article_body: A Jharkhand court on Monday sent suspended IAS officer and state Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal and her chartered accountant to four-day Enforcement Directorate remand. ED arrested Singhal on May 12 in connection with a money laundering case linked to the alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. "Data has been collected from digital devices and they'll be confronted," ED lawyer said.

194.title: Man makes fake FB ID of Amit Shah, makes abusive remarks against MLA
194.article_body: A man allegedly created a fake Facebook profile of Union Home Minister Amit Shah and made abusive remarks about former Baikunthpur MLA Mithilesh Tiwari. The incident came to light on Sunday after Tiwari lodged a complaint with the Mohammadpur Police. "We have arrested a person named Vicky Kumar Singh from Devkali village," said Anand Kumar, SHO of Mohammadpur Police Station.

195.title: Non-profit behind collapsed Terra ecosystem to compensate users
195.article_body: The Luna Foundation Guard (LFG), a non-profit organisation that supports the Terra ecosystem, on Monday announced that it will compensate the remaining users of TerraUSD/UST, after the stablecoin collapsed last week. "We're still debating through various distribution methods," the LFG tweeted. It spent millions of dollars worth of crypto trying to defend UST's dollar peg last week, it added.

196.title: B'luru Police chief Kamal Pant transferred, CH Pratap Reddy to replace him
196.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday transferred Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant with immediate effect. CH Pratap Reddy, who held the post of Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, will replace him until further orders. Pant has been transferred to the post of Director General of Police, Recruitment.

197.title: Good news: UP Deputy CM on 'Shivling' being found at Gyanvapi Mosque
197.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM KP Maurya on Monday said he was happy about reports claiming the existence of a "Shivling" at the Gyanvapi Mosque complex in Varanasi. "The truth has come to light. We will welcome and follow orders of the court in the matter," Maurya said. "The situation in Uttar Pradesh is very good. Everybody is happy," he added.

198.title: Centre should ensure security of Kashmiri Pandits: CM Kejriwal
198.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the Centre should ensure the security of Kashmiri Pandits. "A Kashmiri Pandit was killed inside his office by terrorists. It seems it was planned. The Indian Army gunned down two terrorists in a day. But the incident has left Kashmiri Pandits scared," CM Kejriwal said in an online briefing.

199.title: Actress Ketaki's phone, laptop seized by police over FB post against Pawar
199.article_body: Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale, who was arrested two days ago over a 'derogatory' Facebook post on NCP chief Sharad Pawar, was on Monday brought to her home in Navi Mumbai by police to collect electronic evidence. Police were at her residence for an hour, where they seized her phone and laptop. Six cases have been filed against the 29-year-old actress.

200.title: PBKS to bowl first against DC, DC make 2 changes to their playing XI
200.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. PBKS are fielding the same playing XI, while DC have made two changes to their playing XI. Khaleel Ahmed and Sarfaraz Khan have replaced Chetan Sakariya and KS Bharat, respectively.

201.title: Brabourne Stadium is a tough place to bowl: RR pacer Trent Boult
201.article_body: RR pacer Trent Boult, who picked two wickets against LSG at the Brabourne Stadium, said that it is a tough place to bowl. Speaking about his performance, Boult said, "Nice to get wickets at the top. I've got a simple game with the ball." Rajasthan defeated Lucknow by 24 runs and Boult was adjudged Player of the Match.

202.title: US FDA warns Sun Pharma over quality lapses at Gujarat plant: Report
202.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has flagged production-related quality control and procedural lapses at India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma's facility in Gujarat's Halol, it has been reported. The health authority reportedly also observed deficient equipment and laboratory standards. It conducted a good manufacturing inspection there from April 26 to May 9.

203.title: Pics of Taj Mahal's underground cells, before & after maintenance, released
203.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) recently released some photographs of the Taj Mahal's underground cells, showing the state of the rooms before and after conservation work. It said the maintenance work was undertaken in the rooms on the riverside and decayed and disintegrated lime plaster was removed. This comes amid a controversy over the 22 locked rooms.

204.title: Renault sells Russia business for 1 ruble to govt-backed entity: Reports
204.article_body: French automaker Renault reached a deal to sell its Russia business and its majority 68% stake in Russia's biggest automaker AvtoVAZ for one ruble, reports said on Monday. Renault's stake in AvtoVAZ would be sold to the state-backed Russian Central Research and Development Automobile and Engine Institute. Renault sold its AvtoVAZ stake with a six-year option to buy it back.

205.title: India-Nepal relations unshakeable like Himalayas: PM in Lumbini
205.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, speaking at the Buddhist Conference in Nepal's Lumbini, said the relationship between India and Nepal is "unshakable like the Himalayas". "The growing...friendship between India and Nepal will work for the benefit of entire humanity amid the kind of global situation that is emerging today," he added. "The devotion to Lord Buddha binds us together," the PM said.

206.title: SC directs IIT to award degree to 'learning disabled' student
206.article_body: Supreme Court has directed the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay (IIT-B) to award a student suffering from 'learning disabilities' his degree in Master in Design, declaring that the student has successfully completed it. The bench of Justices directed IIT-B to take appropriate steps including handing over the degree and all other testimonials to the appellant, Naman Verma, within four weeks.

207.title: Every player stepped up when it mattered: Srikanth on India's Thomas Cup win
207.article_body: Shuttler Kidambi Srikanth, who remained undefeated in India's maiden Thomas Cup title-winning campaign, said his performance in final against Indonesia was one of his best. He added, "I don't think this is one individual's win, it's about all 10 players. Everyone stepped up when it mattered." Srikanth beat Jonatan Christie 21-15, 23-21 in third match, helping India beat Indonesia 3-0.

208.title: Stones hurled at Dalit man's wedding venue in MP, 5 arrested
208.article_body: A group of people allegedly threw stones at the wedding venue of a Dalit man in Madhya Pradesh, following which the marriage procession was taken out under police protection, an official said on Monday. A case was registered against 40 people, including 18 unidentified persons, while five were arrested, the official added.

209.title: IndiGo handled passengers inappropriately: DGCA as special needs boy denied boarding
209.article_body: DGCA on Monday revealed findings of its inquiry into the Ranchi incident, where a specially-abled boy wasn't allowed to board a flight. It said that prima facie, the airline staff 'handled passengers inappropriately'. The incident resulted in "certain non-conformances with the applicable regulations" by IndiGo, the aviation regulator said. It also issued a show-cause notice to the airline.

210.title: Not worried at all: Sourav Ganguly on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's form
210.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said that he is not worried at all about the form of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in IPL 2022. He added, "They are too good…real big players. The T20 World Cup 2022 is far away and I am quite confident that they will be in top shape much before the tournament."

211.title: No heatwave in Delhi for next 4 days: IMD
211.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Delhi and other north Indian states will abate from Tuesday for the next four days, IMD senior scientist RK Jenamani said. On Sunday, Mungeshpur and Najafgarh observatories in Delhi recorded 49.2 degrees Celsius and 49.1 degrees Celsius respectively. "In May, the first 10 days were good...I don't think it'll be very unusual this month," he added.

212.title: 432 fined in 2 days for driving on wrong side of road in Gurugram
212.article_body:
At least 432 people were fined in two days for driving on the wrong side during a road safety drive launched by the Gurugram Traffic Police to reduce accidents in the city. 
According to traffic police officials, around 15% of the road fatalities in the city happen due to wrong-side driving. A fine of ₹500 is issued for wrong-side driving.

213.title: US-based customers use Tesla cars to mine $800/month in crypto
213.article_body: Tesla owners are using their cars as a power source to mine cryptocurrency. San Francisco-based Siraj Raval hacked his Model 3's onboard internal firmware to mine up to $800 worth of cryptocurrency every month. Wisconsin-based Chris Allessi connected a power inverter and a bitcoin miner to his Model S' battery to mine bitcoin and monero.

214.title: Actress Neena Gupta's autobiography to be adapted into a film
214.article_body: Veteran actress Neena Gupta has revealed that someone has "shown an interest" in adapting her autobiography 'Sach Kahun Toh' into a film. When asked about whether she has an actor in mind to play her onscreen, the actress said, "Mere kehne se kya hota hai (It doesn't matter what I say). The producer will decide who is fit for it."

215.title: 2nd-set tie-breaker was vintage him: Roddick on Djokovic's Italian Open win
215.article_body: Praising Novak Djokovic following his 6-0, 7-6(7-5) win over Stefanos Tsitsipas to clinch his record-extending 38th ATP Masters 1000 title at Italian Open on Sunday, ex-world number one Andy Roddick said, "Second-set tie-breaker was vintage Novak." The top-seed took an early lead in tie-break before Tsitsipas levelled the score. However, Djokovic converted on his very first match point at 6-5.

216.title: Pics of 'underground city' in Finland's capital surface amid Russian attack fears
216.article_body: Pictures of Finnish capital Helsinki's 'underground city' with hundreds of bunkers have surfaced online, amid fears of Russian retaliation against Finland's bid to join NATO. The underground city can reportedly shelter 900,000 people, a third more than Helsinki's population of 600,000 people, for months in case of a war. The hidden city has a swimming pool and a hockey rink.

217.title: WhatsApp Pay to display user's legal name to avoid UPI frauds
217.article_body: WhatsApp will now display users' legal name for every transaction they make on WhatsApp Pay to mitigate fraud on UPI payments system. The company said the name associated with a user's bank account, identified using their phone number on WhatsApp, is the name that will be shared. WhatsApp users have the choice to pick any name on the app.

218.title: Which Indian women wrestlers have qualified for Commonwealth Games 2022?
218.article_body: As many as six Indian women wrestlers have qualified for Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. Pooja Gehlot and Vinesh Phogat have qualified for the 50kg and 53kg categories, respectively. Meanwhile, Anshu Malik, Sakshi Malik and Divya Kakran have qualified for 57kg, 62kg and 68kg events, respectively. Pooja Dhanda will participate in the 76kg event at CWG 2022.

219.title: Water supply to be affected in parts of Delhi from tomorrow
219.article_body: Parts of Delhi will face disruption in water supply from Tuesday morning due to depletion of pond level of Yamuna river at Wazirabad and reduction in release of raw water from Haryana, Delhi Jal Board said. The water supply will remain affected till the pond level improves to normal. Kamla Nagar and Karol Bagh are among the affected areas.

220.title: Heard is a sociopath, wants to destroy Depp: His friend Gina Deuters
220.article_body: Johnny Depp's longtime friend and his business partner Stephen Deuters' wife Gina has said that Amber Heard "wants to destroy" ex-husband Johnny Depp. Gina further stated that Stephen called Heard "a sociopathic showbiz pony" when he was mediating the couple before their marriage ended. Depp is suing Heard for defamation following her claim of being a victim of sexual violence.

221.title: Autos in Gautam Buddha Nagar told to fix meter, end arbitrary fares
221.article_body: Auto-rickshaws without meters will not be allowed to ply on Noida and Greater Noida roads in a bid by Gautam Buddha Nagar transport department to stop them from charging arbitrary fares, officials said. Fitness certificate will also be mandatory for auto-rickshaws plying in the twin-cities. Legal action will be taken against erring drivers, Assistant Regional Transport Officer AK Pandey said.

222.title: Goldman Sachs allows senior employees to take unlimited leaves
222.article_body: Goldman Sachs will allow partners and managing directors to take as much time off as they want under a new "flexible vacation" to "rest and recharge", according to an internal memo. "As of May 1, there will be no cap on paid leave and senior staff can take time off without a fixed vacation day entitlement," the memo said.

223.title: Mumbai doctor assaulted, robbed by youth he met on gay dating app
223.article_body: A senior doctor was assaulted and his iPhone and wallet were stolen by four persons in Mumbai. The victim had met one of the accused on a gay dating application, where the accused youth asked him to meet him at a secluded place. "The accused targeted victims on dating application assuming they would not approach the police," an officer said.

224.title: 4 tourists killed, 3 injured as car falls into gorge in Himachal
224.article_body: Four tourists were killed and three others injured after an SUV in which they were travelling fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district on Monday. The car had a Delhi registration number, police said. The injured passengers, including two women, were admitted to a hospital, the police added.

225.title: Samantha shares 1st poster of 'Kushi', fans say 'Release in Hindi'
225.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared the first poster of her upcoming film with Vijay Deverakonda titled 'Kushi' on social media on Monday. The film will be releasing in four languages including Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam. A social media user commented, "Sam why not in Hindi," while another wrote, "Hindi me bhi release krdo...Thodi daya krdo hum pr bhi."

226.title: Kuldeep Yadav & I can communicate without even speaking: Chahal
226.article_body: Yuzvendra Chahal, speaking about his relationship with spinner Kuldeep Yadav, has said, "I have the kind of bond with him where we can communicate without even speaking." In the ongoing IPL 2022, RR's Chahal is currently the purple cap-holder with 24 wickets in 13 matches so far. DC's Kuldeep has 18 wickets in 12 matches in the tournament so far.

227.title: PBKS are a more settled line-up with Bairstow at the top: Lisa
227.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Lisa Sthalekar has opined that Punjab Kings are a more settled batting lineup with batter Jonny Bairstow playing as an opener. "Bairstow's numbers opening the batting in the IPL are outstanding," she said. Talking about Bairstow's 29-ball 66 runs versus RCB, she said, "He's too much of a class player...we saw that at Brabourne Stadium against RCB."

228.title: Babil Khan shares pics with late father Irrfan, reveals motivation
228.article_body: Actor Babil Khan took to social media on Monday to share a series of childhood pictures with his father late actor Irrfan Khan and a picture of his mother Sutapa when she was pregnant. Babil wrote in the caption, "The motivation to endure the torment of being in this industry is stubborn because it's beyond personal desires."

229.title: Kiara not approached for Prabhas-starrer 'Spirit': Kiara's spokesperson
229.article_body: Earlier reports surfaced that Kiara Advani will be seen opposite Prabhas in Sandeep Reddy's film 'Spirit', however, Kiara's spokesperson confirmed that she hasn't been approached for the film. "In case of any update, we'd officially announce and inform everyone. Hence, kindly request everyone to refrain from indulging in the rumours," her spokesperson said.

230.title: DC's David Warner will be very valuable in match vs PBKS: Piyush
230.article_body: Piyush Chawla said DC opener David Warner will be "very valuable" in the match against PBKS. "Warner will play the big innings, holding one end for his team. He'll take all the pressure on himself...give others the chance to come and score quickly," Chawla added. Warner is IPL 2022's third-highest runscorer with 427 runs in 10 matches so far.

231.title: Activists block docking of ship 'carrying Russian diesel' in UK
231.article_body: Greenpeace on Monday said that its activists stopped an oil tanker carrying "33,000 tonnes of Russian diesel" from docking in the UK's Essex. The environmental organisation added that they did so in a protest against buying Russian fossil fuels which will "fund" the war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, the police said that eight people have been arrested in the matter.

232.title: PBKS should replace Harpreet Brar with Sandeep Sharma against DC: Chopra
232.article_body: Former India batter Aakash Chopra has suggested that PBKS should play with pacer Sandeep Sharma instead of left-arm spinner Harpreet Brar against DC on Monday. "If you look at Delhi's line-up, you will find (left-handers) David Warner, Rishabh Pant and Axar Patel as well...In the match-ups, Sandeep Sharma could be more than a handful," Chopra said.

233.title: Kejriwal trying to scare people over anti-encroachment drive: BJP
233.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is trying to "scare and blackmail" people over the BJP-ruled civic bodies' anti-encroachment drive, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said on Monday. However, Bangladeshis, Rohingyas, rioters and those involved in illegal activities, “who are protected by the Aam Aadmi Party”, won't be spared, Gupta said. Centre has given ownership rights to 40 lakh people, he added.

234.title: Boring work for Namma Metro suspended 713 times due to geological conditions
234.article_body: The boring work for Namma Metro has been suspended 713 times due to unfavourable geological conditions. Underground rocks and rocky soil have made it more difficult for Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) to complete the Namma Metro's phase 2 underground section. Reports said cutter discs are worn out or there is a delay in installing suitable ones.

235.title: BJP after all our mosques: Mehbooba Mufti on Gyanvapi mosque case
235.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday, while criticising the BJP-led central government over the Gyanvapi mosque case, said, "They are after all our mosques." "Our God is wherever we worship. Give us a list of all mosques you are eyeing," she added. "Would everything be okay when they take all of it?" the PDP chief asked.

236.title: Adani Group liable for fines on Ambuja Cements & ACC; no tax liability for Holcim
236.article_body: The Holcim Group has said that there will be no indemnity or tax liability for them in its $10.5 billion transaction where it sold its stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC to the Adani Group. The Adani group is now liable for anti-trust fines against Ambuja Cements and ACC in India which are being litigated in the Supreme Court.

237.title: Hope it doesn't affect my car insurance: Alan Ritchson on joining 'Fast X'
237.article_body: Alan Ritchson, who plays Jack Reacher in series 'Reacher', has joined the cast of 'Fast X', the 10th instalment in the 'Fast and Furious' franchise. The actor, in an Instagram post, confirmed the news, writing, "Really hope this doesn't affect my car insurance." The film, directed by Louis Leterrier, will also feature Vin Diesel along with Jason Momoa and others.

238.title: You make everything better: Katrina on husband Vicky Kaushal's b'day
238.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif wished her husband, actor Vicky Kaushal on his 34th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Katrina shared pictures with Vicky from New York along with a message. She wrote, "New York wala birthday. My love. Simply put, you make everything better." Reacting to the post, Vicky wrote, "Shaadishuda wala Birthday!"

239.title: Took 50 wickets in last 10 Ranji games, Test cricket is still my priority: Chahal
239.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who's yet to make his Test debut, has said that playing the longest format of the game is still his "first priority". He added, "I [took] 50 wickets in my last 10 Ranji Trophy matches...I think being called a Test player has a different aura." Notably, Chahal last played a first-class match in December 2018.

240.title: Married woman stabbed to death by former lover in Andhra's Bapatla
240.article_body: A married woman was allegedly stabbed to death by a man, with whom she allegedly had extramarital relations in the past, in a village located in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla district. The deceased, identified as Sharada (27), was chased by the accused, identified as Padma Rao, who ran away after stabbing her neck, the deceased's mother alleged.

241.title: Forest fire breaks out near Kasauli's air force station; 4 injured
241.article_body: A forest fire that broke out near the air force station in Himachal Pradesh's Kasauli on Sunday has been brought under control a day later, according to officials. Four people, including three firemen, were injured in the incident. "It was tough. The relentless efforts of the air force personnel and firefighters finally yielded result," the town's sub-divisional magistrate said.

242.title: Another grave mistake: Russia on Finland, Sweden's decision of joining NATO
242.article_body: Russia on Monday warned that decisions by Finland and Sweden to join the NATO military alliance were serious mistakes and Moscow would take measures. "This is another grave mistake with far-reaching consequences," Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said. "They should have no illusions that we will just put up with this," he added.

243.title: Wasn't easy to step into the shoes of Rannvijay: Sood on 'Roadies'
243.article_body: Sonu Sood, speaking about replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host of the show 'Roadies', said that it was not easy for him initially to step into the shoes of Rannvijay. "After shooting for 40-45 days in South Africa, I realised that I connected with the ex as well as new roadies and it was like a family reunion," he added.

244.title: Lack of rain to blame for intense, prolonged heatwave in Delhi: IMD
244.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that the lack of rain is the primary catalyst for the intense and prolonged heat spell across the region, with Delhi also not recording any significant western disturbances. A western disturbance is expected on Monday and on May 21, but they're unlikely to bring any rain, reports said.

245.title: Thieves return temple idols claiming they had 'nightmares' after theft in UP
245.article_body: Thieves have returned 14 of the 16 idols that they stole from an ancient Balaji temple in UP's Chitrakoot, police said on Monday. The idols worth crores were found in a sack near the Mahant's residence with a letter from the thieves, officials said. The thieves wrote they were having 'scary dreams' at night after committing the crime, they added.

246.title: Disgusting when people make fun of overweight & underweight people: Paresh
246.article_body: During an interview, actor Paresh Rawal said it looks "ugly and disgusting" when people make fun of disabled, overweight and underweight people. He added, "People who make a laughing stock out of such topics should be punished." Praising Kapil Sharma's style of comedy, Paresh said, "He has the capacity to bring laughter with...lines which have no humour in them."

247.title: Arshdeep is keeping big players like Dhoni, Hardik silent in death overs: Irfan
247.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh, stating that the 23-year-old is a special player, who's going to be the "next big thing" for the franchise. "He's keeping big players like MS Dhoni, Hardik Pandya or someone else silent in the death overs and that speaks volumes about the kind of talent he possesses," added Irfan.

248.title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker get legally married in California
248.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker got legally married in an intimate ceremony in California's Santa Barbara on Sunday, reports said. Pictures from the ceremony have also surfaced online with Kardashian seen in a short white dress and Barker in a black suit. One of the pictures showed the couple riding in a car with a 'Just Married' sign.

249.title: Bitcoin has no future as a payments network: FTX's billionaire CEO
249.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's 30-year-old billionaire CEO, Sam Bankman-Fried, has said that Bitcoin has no future as a payments network, Financial Times reported. The billionaire also criticised the digital currency for its inefficiency and high environmental costs. Later in a tweet, he clarified, "To be clear, I also said that it does have potential as a store of value."

250.title: Mahesh Babu's 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' crosses ₹100-crore mark worldwide
250.article_body: Mahesh Babu's action drama 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark worldwide. As per a tweet by production house Mythri Movie Makers, the Parasuram directorial has earned more than ₹103 crore at the worldwide box office. The film, which was released on May 12, also stars Keerthy Suresh, Nadiya Moidu and Sowmyaa Menon among others in pivotal roles.

251.title: Tesla recalls 1,07,293 China-made vehicles due to overheating
251.article_body: Tesla is recalling 1,07,293 China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles due to overheating that may cause the centre touchscreen display to malfunction, China's market regulatory agency said on Monday. As per the State Administration for Market Regulation, the overheating could also lead to windshield settings and gear displays malfunctions. Last week, Tesla recalled 1,30,000 vehicles in the US.

252.title: No one can harm AIADMK till I am here: Expelled leader Sasikala
252.article_body: Expelled AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has said that no one can harm the party as long as she is around. Speaking at a wedding ceremony on Sunday, she added, "Just as it [the party] recovered every time, the party will be revived and until then I will not rest." Sasikala urged party workers to be patient.

253.title: UP cow slaughter suspect's mother killed during raid, police booked for murder
253.article_body: A 50-year-old woman died after being shot during a police raid in a village in Uttar Pradesh. Police had gone to the village to apprehend the woman's son, a suspect in a cow slaughter case. The villagers allegedly attacked the police team with stones and fired gunshots, following which police opened fire. Unnamed police personnel have been booked for murder.

254.title: Shehnaaz to play the role of South Indian woman in 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
254.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill will reportedly play the role of a South Indian woman in Salman Khan-starrer 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. Photos and videos of the actress from a shoot have gone viral on social media platforms. In a leaked video, reportedly from the sets of 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', Shehnaaz is seen getting down from her vanity van in her costume.

255.title: Won't lie, there's a bit of pressure now: Rahul on LSG's loss vs RR
255.article_body: Following their 24-run loss against RR in IPL 2022, LSG captain KL Rahul said, "I won't lie, yes, there is a bit of pressure," as they are placed third on the points table. Notably, a win against RR would have guaranteed LSG a top-two finish. "We could've so easily been sitting today and could have qualified [for playoffs]," he added.

256.title: 50% of tourism in India is because of Mughals: Mehbooba Mufti
256.article_body: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said 50% of the tourism in India is because of Mughals. "BJP wants to destroy the tourism sector in India," Mufti added. "They are after all our mosques. They are after the Gyanvapi Mosque now. Our God is wherever we worship. Give us a list of all mosques you are eyeing," Mufti stated.

257.title: Over 41,000 people from 222 villages affected in Assam floods: ASDMA
257.article_body: The Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) flood report has revealed that over 41,000 people from 222 villages have been affected by the recent flash floods and landslides that have occurred in the state. Notably, the report also said that around 1,685 affected individuals have been rescued and taken to relief camps.

258.title: Harsh Goenka lists 'Top 10 startup mistakes', includes poor hiring, lack of focus
258.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka tweeted a graph and captioned it as 'Top 10 startup mistakes'. As per the graph, the three biggest mistakes made by start-ups are building something nobody wants, poor hiring and lack of focus. These are followed by failure to execute sales and marketing, not having the right co-founders and chasing investors and not customers.

259.title: My character was a spoilt brat with wounded heart: Preity on 19 yrs of Armaan
259.article_body: As Preity Zinta's film 'Armaan' completed 19 years, she took to her Instagram handle and shared a video of the movie's song titled 'Mere Dil Ka Tumse' which also features actor Anil Kapoor. She wrote, "Uff! Armaan! This film was special in so many ways. I got to experience a complex 'Sonia', a psychotic spoilt brat with a wounded heart."

260.title: Win was satisfying, atmosphere is chilled, nice: Samson
260.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said that the win against LSG was satisfying and the atmosphere in camp is "chilled and nice". Samson, however, also added that it's not easy to maintain such an atmosphere when there are defeats. "Batting first suits our approach well, we want to bat positively...[as] the bowling unit is good," he further said.

261.title: Heavy traffic at Mumbai's Eastern Express due to closure of JVLR flyover
261.article_body: Heavy traffic jam has been witnessed since Saturday at Mumbai's Eastern Express Highway because of Jogeshwari-Vikhroli Link Road (JVLR) flyover being shut due to some ongoing repair work. A large chunk of the jam is being witnessed from Mumbai to Thane and Powai to Thane routes. The traffic jam will remain the same till May 24, officials said.

262.title: First commercial flight takes off from Yemen capital in years
262.article_body: Yemen's national airline on Monday flew its first commercial plane from capital Sanaa in almost six years. The flight, which was bound for Amman in Jordan, carried dozens of Yemenis, including patients travelling to get medical treatment. This comes after the UN brokered a two-month truce between the Saudi-led coalition and the Iran-backed Houthi rebels.

263.title: BJP govt destroyed economy, wants to create 2 Hindustans: Rahul
263.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday accused PM Narendra Modi of destroying the economy and said that BJP wants to create two Hindustans, with one for the rich and the second for Dalits and farmers. "The BJP government has attacked our economy. PM did demonetisation, wrongly implemented GST, due to which the economy got destroyed," he said.

264.title: 'The Kashmir Files' has given birth to hate in country: Farooq Abdullah
264.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Monday said that he met LG Manoj Sinha to raise the issue of the law and order situation in Jammu and Kashmir. "During the meeting, I told him that the film 'The Kashmir Files' has given birth to hate in the country," Abdullah added. "Such things (films) should be banned," Abdullah stated.

265.title: Delhi policeman out to catch man in stabbing case stabbed by same accused
265.article_body: A Delhi Police official who had gone to catch an accused involved in a stabbing incident was stabbed by the same accused. The accused, Virender, stabbed head constable Praveen when he and Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Sanjeev went to raid Virender's premises. The ASI then fired a shot in self-defence that hit Virender in the leg.

266.title: MGK dedicates BBMAs performance to 'wife' Megan Fox, 'unborn child'
266.article_body: Singer Machine Gun Kelly dedicated one of the songs from his performance at the Billboard Music Awards 2022 to his "wife" actress Megan Fox instigating rumours of the couple having married in a secret ceremony. The singer also dedicated a song to their "unborn child" which is being considered a pregnancy announcement from the couple by their fans.

267.title: McDonald's to exit Russia after 32 years, sell its business in the country
267.article_body: McDonald's on Monday said it's selling its Russian business, marking the American fast-food chain's exit from Russia after 32 years in the country. McDonald's cited humanitarian crisis caused by the Russia-Ukraine war, adding that its Russian business "is no longer tenable, nor is it consistent with McDonald's values". McDonald's has 850 restaurants in Russia that employ 62,000 people.

268.title: Hetmyer likely to be available for RR's game against CSK on May 20
268.article_body: RR's Shimron Hetmyer, who had left the bio-bubble to travel back to Guyana for the birth of his first child, has rejoined the squad and is likely to be available for their last league match on May 20 against CSK. Hetmyer missed matches against DC and LSG. RR defeated LSG on Sunday to register their eighth win of IPL 2022.

269.title: JD(U) fields Anil Hegde for Bihar Rajya Sabha by-poll
269.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) has fielded Anil Hegde as its candidate for the Rajya Sabha by-elections in Bihar. The by-polls were necessitated due to the demise of sitting JD(U) MP Mahendra Prasad in December 2021. Hegde, originally from Karnataka's Mangaluru, has been residing in Patna and working on strengthening the party's organisation for decades now, a JD(U) leader said.

270.title: Kareena poses with West Bengal Police as she shoots for Sujoy Ghosh's next
270.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor has begun shooting for Sujoy Ghosh's 'The Devotion of Suspect X' in West Bengal's Kalimpong. Photos from Kareena's visit to a local family's house have surfaced on social media. In the photos, Kareena can be seen sitting with a group of women. She also met the West Bengal Police as they all posed for a picture.

271.title: Director Lokesh confirms Suriya's cameo in Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram'
271.article_body: Lokesh Kanagaraj, director of Kamal Haasan, Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil-starrer 'Vikram', confirmed during an event that Suriya will make a cameo appearance in the upcoming film. Kamal, who was also present at the event, thanked Suriya for graciously accepting the offer, despite being asked to join the shoot at the last minute. 'Vikram' will release on June 3.

272.title: NHRC team visits Mundka fire site to probe human rights violations
272.article_body: A team of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) visited the four-storey building in Delhi's Mundka where 27 people died in a massive fire on May 13. "It is the first day of the probe and it will progress as we get more facts," NHRC DG Sunil Meena said. The Commission took suo moto cognizance of the incident on Sunday.

273.title: Oppn parties have gone into overdrive against criticism: Pradhan
273.article_body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan tweeted on Monday that "champions of free speech today are [the] real threat to freedom of expression and plurality." He said that Opposition parties have gone into an "overdrive" against criticism and that people like NCP chief Sharad Pawar and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal have taken it "too far". "Is their esteem so fragile?" he added.

274.title: Flight makes emergency landing in Mumbai as drunk man misbehaves with air hostess
274.article_body: A Doha-Bengaluru flight was forced to make an emergency landing in Mumbai on Saturday after a drunk passenger allegedly created ruckus on board. Police said Sarfuddin Ulwar allegedly misbehaved with an air hostess when she tried to stop him from drinking and also abused fellow passengers. Ulwar was arrested and booked under the Indian Penal Code and the Aircraft Act.

275.title: Blaming India won't solve problem: Chinese media as G7 criticises wheat export ban
275.article_body: China has reportedly come to India's defence after the Group of Seven (G7) industrialised nations criticised it for banning wheat exports. "Blaming India won't solve the food problem," said Global Times, a Chinese government outlet. "Why won't G7 nations themselves move to stabilise food market supply by hiking their exports?" the Global Times asked.

276.title: Sri Lanka reimposes nationwide curfew till Tuesday morning
276.article_body: Sri Lanka will reimpose a nationwide curfew which will be in effect from 8 pm on Monday to 5 am on Tuesday. The curfew was lifted on Sunday on the occasion of the Buddhist festival, Vesak. More than 200 people have been reportedly arrested on various grounds, including violating the curfew, amid protests over the economic crisis in the country.

277.title: Manushi receives 'Prithviraj' outfit as gift from makers on b'day, shares video
277.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, who turned 25 on May 14, was gifted an outfit she wore on the first day of the shoot of her debut film 'Prithviraj'. She took to Instagram to share an unboxing video with a caption that read, "What a start to my Birthday. Thank you YRF (Yash Raj Films) and Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi (film's director)."

278.title: FirstCry halts $1 bn IPO plans amid market volatility: Report
278.article_body: E-commerce unicorn FirstCry, which was to file its draft IPO papers in May, has delayed its planned $1 billion initial public offering (IPO) by a few months, the Economic Times reported. The kids' marketplace is reportedly reevaluating the pricing and issue size. This comes following a muted response to Delhivery's IPO last week amid broader market volatility, the report said.

279.title: Hope we get a charter plane back: Chirag Shetty to Air India's tweet on Thomas Cup win
279.article_body: Responding to Air India's congratulatory message on the Indian men's badminton team winning the Thomas Cup for the first time ever, shuttler Chirag Shetty wrote, "Hope we can get a charter plane back!" Air India had tweeted, "Congratulations to the Indian Men's Badminton Team...This victory will give wings to the dreams of all young sportspersons of our country."

280.title: 7 buffaloes killed, 15 injured by unidentified persons in Thane
280.article_body: Seven buffaloes were killed and 15 others were injured by some unidentified individual or persons in the Bhiwandi area of Thane, police said. "The motive may be professional rivalry. A case has been registered and efforts are on to arrest the culprits," a police officer said. The incident took place in a cattle shelter in Bunder Mohalla.

281.title: Best thing for Sweden's security is to join NATO: PM Andersson
281.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson on Sunday said that joining NATO is the "best thing" for the security of the country and its people. This comes after Andersson's party Social Democrats announced that it will work towards applying for NATO membership amid the Russia-Ukraine war. "We believe Sweden needs the formal security guarantees that come with membership in NATO," she added.

282.title: Adani Group to buy 49% stake in Quintillion Business Media
282.article_body: Adani's AMG Media Networks will buy a 49% stake in Raghav Bahl-run platform Quintillion Business Media Ltd (QBML) for an undisclosed amount. It signed a Shareholders' Agreement with Quintillion Media Ltd (QML), QBML and a share purchase agreement with QML, QBML and Quint Digital Media Ltd (QDML). In March, Adani Group said it will acquire a minority stake in QBML.

283.title: Neha Sharma, Aisha Sharma to create show 'Shining with the Sharmas'
283.article_body: Actress Neha Sharma and her sister Aisha Sharma will be creating a short-format content show about their personal lives for a social media platform titled 'Shining with the Sharmas'. The show will reportedly be along the lines of American reality television show 'Keeping Up With The Kardashians'. The show will capture their lives at the gym, photoshoots and their downtime.

284.title: PM signs sketch of him & Lord Buddha made by a boy in Nepal, video surfaces
284.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday autographed a sketch of him and Lord Buddha reportedly made by a  boy in Nepal's Lumbini. A video showed PM Modi signing the sketch depicting him seeking the blessings of Lord Buddha, during the PM's meeting with the Indian community in Lumbini. The crowd is heard chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai (Long Live Mother India)'.

285.title: US has made Pakistan a slave without invading it: Ex-PM Imran Khan
285.article_body: The US has made Pakistan a slave without invading it, Pakistan's ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan has claimed. "The people of Pakistan will never accept the imported government," he added. Khan, who was voted out of power last month through a no-confidence motion, has repeatedly alleged that his ouster was plotted by the US with the help of local players.

286.title: It won't be a bad idea to get him in: Parthiv on playing Dhull vs PBKS
286.article_body: Ahead of DC-PBKS in IPL 2022, Parthiv Patel said it won't be a bad idea to include 19-year-old Yash Dhull in DC's squad for their must-win match. He added that Dhull's mindset will be very positive and fresh as he has scored runs in Under-19 World Cup and Ranji Trophy. Both DC and PBKS have six wins each so far.

287.title: 'Liger' is a full-on masala film, it will make people really happy: Ananya
287.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday, speaking about her upcoming movie 'Liger', said that it is a "full-on masala film" and it will make people really happy. The film, scheduled to release in theatres on August 25, will also feature Vijay Deverakonda. Sharing her experience of working with Deverakonda, Ananya said, "Amazing...We had a lot of fun when we were shooting in USA."

288.title: Irrfan was perfect picture of Lord Shiva at Babil's birth: Sutapa Sikdar
288.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's wife Sutapa Sikdar recently shared a series of throwback pictures of Babil on Instagram as he turned 24. In a picture, Irrfan is seen holding baby Babil. Alongside the post, Sutapa wrote, "The smile on Irrfan's face when he first saw you couldn't be recreated in a performance by Irrfan himself...Irrfan was...perfect picture of Lord Shiva."

289.title: Mumbai civic body plans dedicated areas for feeding stray dogs
289.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to create dedicated areas for feeding stray dogs. "The designated places will help reduce conflict between people who feed dogs in open areas and other residents. The BMC will also speak with animal rights activists," said a BMC official. Finding dedicated areas may be difficult due to land constraint, some officials said.

290.title: Man stabs Delhi Jal Board worker over road rage, shot at by police
290.article_body: Police have arrested a man who allegedly stabbed a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) worker and threatened him with a pistol during a fight in Burari. Police said the victim was unloading construction material from his vehicle when the accused started fighting over space. The accused was arrested after police shot at him and overpowered him.

291.title: Banks to approach RBI to change definition of 'fraud': Report
291.article_body: Several banks will approach the Reserve Bank of India asking to change the definition of the word "fraud", according to a report. At present, all banks need to label a borrowing company as 'fraud account' if it has been marked by one lender. As per bankers, this often leads to legalities even after the amount is repaid by the borrower.

292.title: Shilpa Shetty reveals first look as superwoman Avni for 'Nikamma'
292.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Monday shared her first look in a superhero avatar as Avni for her upcoming film 'Nikamma' on social media. Her sister, actress Shamita Shetty commented on her post, writing, "Hotness personified!" Shilpa had earlier shared a blank picture with the caption, "Soooo bored of the monotony...going off social media till I find a new avatar."

293.title: US to hold first public hearing on UFOs since the 1960s tomorrow
293.article_body: A US Congress panel will on Tuesday (May 17) conduct a public hearing on reports of Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs) for the first time since the 1960s. Lawmaker Andre Carson, who will oversee the hearing, said, "Someone has to do it...We all watch television, we've heard...(and) read things. We want to see the footage and have it explained to us."

294.title: We have been very impressed with Wriddhiman Saha: Gary Kirsten
294.article_body: GT batting coach Gary Kirsten has said it's great to have Wriddhiman Saha in their team in the ongoing IPL season. "We've been very impressed [with Saha]...He understands his game and plays really well in the powerplay," added Kirsten. So far, the 37-year-old has scored 281 runs in eight games. He scored 67* off 57 to help GT defeat CSK.

295.title: Dadagiri, gundagardi not okay: Kejriwal to MCD over demolition drive
295.article_body: Criticising the BJP-led MCD for its anti-encroachment drive in Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal said that doing dadagiri, gundagardi is not okay and added that he's told party members to stand by the people. Their plan is to break all unauthorised colonies in Delhi, where 50 lakh people stay and to destroy jhuggis, where 10 lakh people are living, he said.

296.title: Nigerian man wanders in semi-undressed state in B'luru; arrested
296.article_body: A 33-year-old Nigerian man who is a resident of Bengaluru's Hennur Cross was arrested after he was found wandering in a semi-undressed state, police said on Monday. The local people had informed the police after they reportedly got irked by the man's behaviour. The man had also allegedly assaulted police officers after they arrived at the spot and questioned him.

297.title: Pune's maximum temperature may rise to 40°C in next few days
297.article_body: The maximum temperature in Pune may rise to 40°C in the next few days, but not higher than that, an India Meteorological Department (IMD) official has said. He said that in the next few days, westerly winds will be getting stronger and cloudy weather will stay. The day temperature at Shivajinagar was 37.6°C on Sunday.

298.title: Rakhi Sawant receives BMW worth ₹40 lakh as gift, shares video
298.article_body: Rakhi Sawant received a BMW X1 worth ₹40 lakh as a gift from boyfriend Adil Khan Durrani and his sister hair and skin specialist Shelly Lather in April. She confirmed dating Adil in an interview with a journalist and shared it on Instagram. She had earlier said, "I'm not Salman Khan to be able to afford such a luxury car."

299.title: Ex-MLA, family members booked for conspiring to kill UP MLA
299.article_body: Former MLA Vijay Mishra, his wife, daughter and three others have been booked for allegedly conspiring to kill Vipul Dubey, the sitting legislator from UP's Gyanpur. Mishra, who won Gyanpur seat four times, lost to Dubey in the recently concluded Assembly polls. An FIR was registered after a video surfaced in which some people were heard plotting to kill Dubey.

300.title: Congress does not want to suppress tribals' history: Rahul Gandhi
300.article_body: The relationship between Congress and the tribals is very old and deep, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said in Rajasthan's Banswara. "We protect your history. We don't want to erase or suppress your history," Gandhi added while addressing a public rally. "During the UPA government, we had brought a historic law to protect your land, forest and water," Gandhi stated.

301.title: 80% Delhi illegal, will it all be destroyed?: Delhi CM on demolition drives
301.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday, while reacting to BJP-ruled civic bodies' anti-encroachment drives, said over 80% of the city can be considered built on encroached land. "Will 80% of Delhi be destroyed?" he asked. "We want to assure people that we will provide a solution to encroachment. We will regularise unauthorised colonies...We'll ensure they have proper sanitation," Kejriwal added.

302.title: I left Mumbai because of parents; felt like a stranger in the crowd: Lucky Ali
302.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali said he wanted to leave Mumbai after his father, actor Mehmood's demise and felt like he didn't belong there. He added that despite knowing a lot of people, he felt like a "stranger in the crowd". Lucky said the responsibilities of his parents took him to Bengaluru. "Mumbai is my maika...I'm Mumbai's Mai ka lal!" he added.

303.title: 2 UP men pose as share brokers, cheat Chandigarh firm of ₹3.66 cr
303.article_body: Two men from Ghaziabad, UP, have been booked for cheating a Manimajra-based firm, in Chandigarh, of ₹3.66 crore. The complainant, director of the firm in Manimajra, said he had met the accused in 2019 and they claimed to be SEBI registered share brokers. The complainant said that he had given the accused ₹3.66 crore to purchase shares.

304.title: Momoa criticised for pics in Vatican chapel, apologises & says 'I took permission'
304.article_body: 'Aquaman' actor Jason Momoa has apologised after being criticised for posing inside the Vatican City's Sistine Chapel and posting the pictures and videos on Instagram. Users had pointed out that photography is banned in the sacred space. "I was very respectful...I asked for permission for what I thought would be okay," said Momoa. He, however, didn't remove the pictures.

305.title: Steve Jobs wanted original iPhone to have no SIM card: iPod's creator
305.article_body: Apple's iPod creator Tony Fadell revealed that Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs wanted the first iPhone with no SIM card slot and wanted it to work on CDMA networks. "We don't want another hole in it (iPhone)," Jobs was quoted as saying by Fadell. "We had to give him data...to tell him that we need a SIM card slot," added Fadell.

306.title: Disappointed with my performance: Chahal on his bowling against LSG
306.article_body: Rajasthan Royals spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has said that he is a "little bit disappointed" with his bowling performance against the Lucknow Super Giants on Sunday. "I was a little bit disappointed with myself...The leg-side was shorter...So I didn't want to give any extra runs. That's why I tried to bowl a little bit quicker tonight," Chahal said.

307.title: Ex-BJP MLC BJ Puttaswamy appointed head seer of mutt in B'luru
307.article_body: Former BJP MLC BJ Puttaswamy has been appointed the head seer of the newly inaugurated Thaileswara Ganigara Mahasamsthana Mutt in Bengaluru. Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa and BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi were among those present at the ceremony. Earlier this month, Puttaswamy had announced that he has taken 'sanyas'.

308.title: Heart issues, mountain sickness kill 39 since start of Char Dham Yatra
308.article_body: At least 39 people have died en route since the commencement of Char Dham Yatra in Uttarakhand, an official said on Monday. The official added that cardiac issues, high blood pressure and mountain sickness have been leading causes of death. Reports said that medically unfit people have been advised to not undertake the Yatra.

309.title: RBI may hike interest rates to pre-pandemic levels by Aug: SBI Research
309.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will inevitably hike interest rates in the upcoming monetary policy meetings and may take the rates up to pre-pandemic levels of 5.15% by August, according to a report by SBI Research. The report added that the rate hikes will be a result of biting inflation caused by the Russia-Ukraine war.

310.title: Andrew Symonds' sister leaves note on cricketer's accident site as tribute
310.article_body: Late Australia cricketer Andrew Symonds' sister Louise left a note on the cricketer's accident site as a tribute. "Gone far too soon! Rest in peace Andrew. I wish we had one more day, one more phone call. My heart is broken. I will always love you my brother," the note read. Symonds passed away in a car accident on Saturday.

311.title: Emergence of Shivling in Gyanvapi Mosque a 'pauranik' message: UP Dy CM
311.article_body: Soon after claims of a Shivling being found in Varanasi's Gyanvapi Mosque complex were reported, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya took to Twitter to hail the incident. "The emergence of 'Baba Mahadev' [Lord Shiva] in Gyanvapi on the occasion of Buddha Purnima is a 'pauranik' [from ancient Hindu scriptures] message for the 'Sanatan' Hindu tradition," he said.

312.title: Union Minister Sitharaman visits Kalena Agrahara lake in Bengaluru
312.article_body: Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday visited Bengaluru's Kalena Agrahara lake, which was restored at a cost of ₹3 crore. The Bengaluru civic body has desilted the 7.3-acre lake and constructed a sewage diversion drain. A walkway and benches have also been set up for visitors and its storage capacity has been increased from 37.389 ML to 58.50 ML.

313.title: LIC shares trade at a discount in grey market ahead of listing: Reports
313.article_body: The shares of LIC were trading at a discount of ₹19 in the grey market on Monday, according to multiple reports. The ₹20,557 crore IPO of the state-run insurer, with the price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, was oversubscribed nearly three times its issue size. The LIC shares will be listed on the stock exchanges on May 17.

314.title: Gang of 10 hacks panchayat chief to death in front of family in TN
314.article_body: A case was filed after a gang of 10 people allegedly hacked a panchayat president to death in front of his family in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Sunday. The incident apparently occurred after a lorry, in which the accused were travelling, collided with the victim's car. The accused had reportedly beaten the man after he came out of the car.

315.title: Raghu Dixit to perform at Cannes, says 'Maybe we'll make French sing in Kannada'
315.article_body: Singer-songwriter Raghu Dixit will be performing at the upcoming 75th edition of the Cannes Film Festival. The singer said that he wants the crowd to have a great time and forget all their worries during his one-hour performance on May 21. "I want everyone to have a good time...Maybe we'll make the French sing in Kannada with us," said Raghu.

316.title: Kangana visits Tirupati Balaji temple ahead of Dhaakad release; shares pics
316.article_body: Actress Kangana recently visited Tirupati Balaji temple in Andhra Pradesh on the occasion of Buddha Purnima ahead of her film Dhaakad's release. Taking to Instagram, she shared pictures of her visit and wrote, "Today on this auspicious [Buddha] Purnima...'Dhaakad' producer, @deepakmukut ji, his wife...along with few more team members sought darshan at Tirupati Balaji."

317.title: Shang-Chi's Simu does bhangra on stage with Tesher, singer shares video
317.article_body: Canadian singer Hitesh Sharma, professionally known as Tesher, has shared a video where he and 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings' actor Simu Liu can be seen doing bhangra on stage at Juno Awards in Toronto. They danced to 'Jalebi Baby', a Punjabi-English song produced by Tesher. "Now that's how we celebrate...Asian heritage," Simu said after doing bhangra.

318.title: BJP's civic bodies will run bulldozers on properties of 63 lakh people: Delhi CM
318.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that BJP-ruled civic bodies will run bulldozers on the shops and houses of 63 lakh people in the capital. "This will be the biggest destruction in Independent India," he added. Further, Kejriwal asked to conduct elections for the civic bodies and added that the new MCD should decide on the encroachment issues.

319.title: Paytm to not acquire Raheja QBE; to apply for new general insurance license
319.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications has said that its proposed acquisition of Raheja QBE General Insurance Company Limited has been called off. It cited the reason, "As the share sale and purchase transaction hasn't...consummated within the time period envisaged by the parties under the...agreement." The company said it intended to apply for a new general insurance license.

320.title: Seal area where Shivling found in Gyanvapi Mosque: Varanasi court
320.article_body: A Varanasi court has ordered the District Magistrate to seal the area of the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling has reportedly been found after its survey. The court prohibited the entry of any person to the area and added that the DM, Police Commissioner, Police Commissionerate and CRPF Commandant Varanasi will be responsible for the security of the sealed area.

321.title: I love Salman Khan, he was 1st to know when I had babies: Krushna
321.article_body: Comedian Krushna Abhishek said that he loves actor Salman Khan. "I love his heart. He wanted me to have kids. He would tell me, 'Kashmera, Krushna you should have babies now.' When I had babies, he was the first one to know," he added. Krushna also said that his sons were conceived on the 13th day after his father's death.

322.title: Charles Leclerc crashes Niki Lauda's 1974 £1-million Ferrari F1 car, video surfaces
322.article_body: Ferrari F1 team driver Charles Leclerc crashed three-time world champion Niki Lauda's 1974 £1-million Ferrari F1 car at the Historic Grand Prix of Monaco, which features some of motorsport’s most iconic vehicles. Leclerc lost control of the vehicle following a brake failure and crashed into a wall. Leclerc had also suffered a crash in Monaco during last year's qualifying race.

323.title: This is a do-or-die match for us: DC's Kuldeep Yadav on match vs PBKS
323.article_body: Ahead of their match against PBKS on Monday, DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav said they've prepared well for the game and will try not to repeat the mistakes they've committed so far in the ongoing IPL season. "This is a do-or-die situation for us," he added. Both DC and PBKS have 12 points from 12 games so far in the tournament.

324.title: China recalls its teachers from Pakistan after Karachi blast
324.article_body: China has reportedly recalled its teachers from Pakistan following the suicide blast in Karachi in which four people, including three Chinese, were killed. The Chinese teachers posted at the Confucius Institute of the University of Karachi left the country. The institutes will continue to run, for which help from Pakistani teachers has been sought.

325.title: Kim Jong-un criticises COVID-19 response as death toll rises to 50
325.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un on Sunday criticised officials for their "irresponsible work attitude" and lack of organisation over their response to the coronavirus outbreak, state-media KCNA reported. This comes as the number of deaths in the country rose to 50 amid the outbreak. Kim also ordered the military to help stabilise the drug supply in Pyongyang, the report said.

326.title: PM Modi, Nepal PM Deuba lay foundation stone of Buddhist Centre in Lumbini
326.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi along with his Nepalese counterpart Sher Bahadur Deuba on Monday laid the foundation stone for the construction of the India International Centre for Buddhist Culture and Heritage in the Lumbini Monastic Zone. The Centre will be constructed by the International Buddhist Confederation (IBC), New Delhi, on a plot allocated by the Lumbini Development Trust (LDT).

327.title: 2 killed at flea market in 3rd shooting incident in 2 days in US
327.article_body: Two people were killed and three others hospitalised after a shooting incident at a flea market in US' Texas on Sunday. All five were involved in an "altercation" that led to the shooting, a police official said. This is the third shooting incident reported in two days after 11 people were killed in separate incidents in California and New York.

328.title: I don't think people understand the emotions of a working mother: Anushka
328.article_body: Speaking about her life as a mother, actress Anushka Sharma said striking a work-life balance is "certainly harder" for women. She said, "I don't think people understand the life and emotions of a working mother because the world is...male-dominated." "Heck, I'm a woman, even I didn’t understand...till I became a mother. Today, I've so much more respect...for women," she added.

329.title: Ex-eBay workers plead guilty to harassing couple with spiders, funeral wreaths
329.article_body: As many as six former employees at eBay have pleaded guilty to harassing a couple, who ran an online newsletter and published several articles critiquing eBay in the US. They sent them live cockroaches, spiders, funeral wreaths, a bloodied pig mask and pornography. The six of them were charged in June 2020 while former CEO Devin Wenig was also sued.

330.title: Wriddhiman has been a real catalyst in GT's comfortable wins: Vettori
330.article_body: Ex-NZ captain Daniel Vettori has said Wriddhiman Saha has been a catalyst in GT's "comfortable wins" in IPL 2022. "Wriddhiman has [scored] enough runs in the powerplay to not put too much pressure on [other batters]...He's been a real catalyst...in going from just winning games to winning them comfortably," explained Vettori. GT defeated CSK by seven wickets on Sunday.

331.title: Ukraine says it destroyed 11 Russian aerial assets, stopped troops
331.article_body: The Ukrainian Air Force claimed that it destroyed 11 Russian aerial assets including two cruise missiles, two helicopters and seven unmanned aerial vehicles. It further claimed to have prevented the Russian troops from crossing the Inhulets river, according to a report. Earlier, the Ukraine military had prevented the Russian troops from crossing the Siverskyi Donets river in the Donetsk region.

332.title: Riots instigated by that party which benefits from it: Ashok Gehlot
332.article_body: Referring to the recent communal clashes across India including Rajasthan, State CM Ashok Gehlot has said that "riots are instigated by the party that benefits from it". "Is Congress benefitting from the riots? Everyone knows that wherever riots happen, the Congress will face the backlash," CM Gehlot said. He further demanded a probe by the Centre on the nationwide clashes.

333.title: Leaders of Bharatiya Kisan Union form separate 'apolitical' outfit
333.article_body: A section of the Bharatiya Kisan Union, which led the 13-month-long farmers' protest against the farm laws, formed a separate outfit on Sunday known as BKU (Apolitical). Announcing the new outfit on the death anniversary of BKU founder Chaudhary Mahendra Singh Tikait, the leaders of BKU (Apolitical) alleged they were upset with "political" statements made by BKU spokesperson Rakesh Tikait.

334.title: 81-year-old man arrested for 'digital rape' of 17-year-old girl for over 7 years in Noida
334.article_body: An 81-year-old man has been arrested in Noida for 'digital rape' of minor for over seven years. The man was living with the 17-year-old rape survivor as her guardian, police said. 'Digital rape' means forced sex using any object other than the reproductive organ. The incident came to light after the survivor shared her plight with a mutual contact.

335.title: Had turban styling expert, 50,000+ costumes were handmade: Prithviraj director
335.article_body: 'Prithviraj' director, Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, said that 500 different turbans were created for the film and over 50,000 costumes were handmade by a costume designer who was flown from Rajasthan to Mumbai. "We had an expert on turban styling on the set who would oversee the process of these turbans being worn by our actors," he added.

336.title: 3 men pose as bank executives, cheat Ludhiana resident of ₹1 lakh
336.article_body: Three men, who posed as bank executives, were booked for cheating a Ludhiana resident of ₹1 lakh. The victim in his complaint said, "They (accused) asked me to download a mobile app and also took my credit and debit card details. Later, they withdrew ₹1 lakh from my account." The complainant took the bank's customer care number from the internet.

337.title: Ratna, Fatima, Dia & Sanjana to star in Taapsee's production 'Dhak Dhak'
337.article_body: Taapsee Pannu's production company Outsiders Films has collaborated with Viacom18 Studios for the film 'Dhak Dhak', which will feature Ratna Pathak Shah, Fatima Sana Shaikh, Dia Mirza and Sanjana Sanghi. Directed by Tarun Dudeja, it'll revolve around four women's life-changing journey to the highest motorable pass in the world. "I'm sure this ride will be an enriching one," Taapsee said.

338.title: India's final destiny is welfare of world: RSS leader Krishna Gopal
338.article_body: The welfare of the world is India's final destiny, RSS leader Krishna Gopal said. "We do not need anything lesser than this...Our thought and behaviour are inclusive. We are incomplete without everyone," Gopal added. The leader described Hindutva as "an epitome of global unity" while adding that it "does not divide humanity".

339.title: Bull hit after it comes in front of speeding motorcycle in UP, couple dies
339.article_body: A 35-year-old man and his 32-year-old wife were killed after the motorcycle they were travelling on hit a stray bull in Uttar Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the bull suddenly came in front of the speeding vehicle. The couple was rushed to community health centre where the doctors declared the two dead.

340.title: 117 people saved from suicide by Hyderabad's Lake Police in 2022
340.article_body: The officials of Hyderabad's Lake Police Station have rescued and counselled 117 people from attempting suicide since January 2022. According to the officials, most people were saved with the help of 220 cameras installed on the 9-km-long road across the lake. Notably, police officials roam in civil dress as well to prevent suicide near the Tank Bund, police said.

341.title: It was a challenging role for Kartik: Rajpal on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
341.article_body: Rajpal Yadav, who'll be seen sharing screen space with Kartik Aaryan in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said that Kartik's performance in the film will touch the hearts of people. "It was a challenging role for Kartik but...he has done a fantastic job," he added. Rajpal further said Kartik's performance in the climax is one of the major highlights of the film.

342.title: Dhoni needs to take Gaikwad under his wing: Shaun Pollock
342.article_body: Ex-SA captain Shaun Pollock has said CSK will have to look for a captain outside their camp if MS Dhoni decides not to play in the next season. He added, "If [CSK management] goes to Ruturaj Gaikwad [for captaincy], you have to give Dhoni another year, and [Dhoni needs to] really take him under his wing."

343.title: Kashmiri Pandit employees to be posted at safer places: J&K L-G after Rahul Bhat's killing
343.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has said that security would be increased in the residential areas of the government Kashmiri Pandit employees in the Valley. He added, "Posting for all of them would be done at safer places in the coming seven days (district centres and tehsil centres)." This comes after terrorists killed Rahul Bhat in his office.

344.title: Unbelievable: Leone as her fans organise blood donation drive on her b'day
344.article_body: Sunny Leone took to Instagram to thank her fans for organising a blood donation camp on her 41st birthday. She shared a picture of a news article, which mentioned that her fans in a Karnataka village "cut a cake, distributed food and conducted a camp that collected 39 units of blood" on her birthday. "This is unbelievable...I'll also...donate...blood," Leone wrote.

345.title: Karnataka govt's portal for online mango sales starts from today
345.article_body: The Karnataka government will start selling mangoes online through its own web portal for this year's mango season from today. The portal was launched in 2020 by the Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited in collaboration with the India Post. Notably, Karnataka cultivates the mango crop on 1.68 lakh hectares spread across 16 districts including Bengaluru Rural.

346.title: B'luru police tracks over 2,500 IP addresses to arrest man who stole a car via OLX ad
346.article_body: The Bengaluru police arrested a man three months after he allegedly stole an SUV on the pretext of taking it for a test drive. He stole the SUV on January 30, from an engineer who had posted an ad about it on OLX. While the accused used a stolen phone, the police tracked him after verifying over 2,500 IP addresses.

347.title: Will charge a bomb if I've to wear dhoti & walk in old Baburao style: Paresh
347.article_body: Speaking about what's actually needed to bring him on board if he has to play the role of 'Baburao' again in 'Hera Pheri' sequel, Paresh Rawal said, "If I've to wear...dhoti and walk in the same way with glasses...I'll charge a bomb!" "There's no excitement left in me for any of my characters unless it's put in...different backdrop," he added.

348.title: Thoughts of Lord Buddha can make our planet more harmonious: PM
348.article_body: On the occasion of Buddha Purnima, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said thoughts of Lord Buddha can make our planet more peaceful, harmonious and sustainable. "On Buddha Purnima, we recall the principles of Lord Buddha and reiterate our commitment to fulfil them," PM tweeted. PM Modi will be visiting Lumbini in Nepal on the occasion of Buddha Purnima on Monday.

349.title: 15-yr-old Pune girl waiting to cross road with aunt hit by a truck, dies
349.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was killed after she was hit by a truck while she was standing at a traffic signal to cross a road in Pune. The incident happened when the deceased girl was on way to her relative's place along with her aunt and cousin. Police said that the driver stopped the truck after hearing screams of people.

350.title: Full lunar eclipse creates rare super blood Moon in parts of world, pics surface
350.article_body: The first lunar eclipse of the year was visible from several countries in Americas, Europe and Africa. The eclipse coincided with a super Moon, which's when the Moon is at its closest point to Earth in its orbit. It created a super blood Moon as the Earth's natural satellite took on a reddish colour due to the Rayleigh scattering effect.

351.title: We will overcome, that's our determination: Sonia Gandhi
