351.article_body: The Congress party will overcome, party chief Sonia Gandhi said in her concluding remarks at the 'chintan shivir' on Sunday. "We will overcome. That is our determination," Gandhi added. "Congress will have a new 'uday' (rising). That is our 'Nav Sankalp'," Gandhi stated. Gandhi also announced that the party will launch a 'National Kanniyakumari to Kashmir Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

352.title: Hate remains a stain on America's soul: Biden on Buffalo shooting
352.article_body: A day after 10 people were killed in New York's Buffalo shooting, US President Joe Biden said, "We must all work together to address the hate that remains a stain on the soul of America." Biden was speaking at the US Capitol in Washington at a memorial event for policemen killed in the line of duty.

353.title: PM Modi lands in Nepal, offers prayers at Maya Devi Temple with Nepal PM Deuba
353.article_body: PM Narendra Modi landed in Nepal on Monday and was received by Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on his arrival in Lumbini. PM Modi visited the Maya Devi Temple in Lumbini, where he and Nepal PM Deuba offered prayers. PM Modi tweeted, "Happy to be among the wonderful people of Nepal on the special occasion of Buddha Purnima."

354.title: Putin is 'very ill with blood cancer', Russian oligarch recorded saying: Report
354.article_body: An unnamed Russian oligarch was recorded saying that country’s President Vladimir Putin is "very ill with blood cancer". In a recording obtained by a US magazine New Lines, the unnamed oligarch was heard discussing Putin's health with a Western venture capitalist. The businessman also said that Putin underwent a surgery shortly before he ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

355.title: Ukrainians flood village on purpose to stop Russia's attack on capital Kyiv; pics surface
355.article_body: Ukrainian forces opened a dam early in the war in Demydiv, a small village north of Kyiv, causing the Irpin River to flood the village and thousands of acres around it. It created a quagmire and submerged cellars and fields but prevented a Russian attack on the capital. Two months later, people are still using inflatable boats to move around.

356.title: 4 NCP workers booked for slapping BJP leader at his Pune office
356.article_body: Pune police have registered a non-cognisable offence against four NCP workers for allegedly slapping BJP leader Vinayak Ambekar at his office in the city over a post against the former's party chief Sharad Pawar. This comes after a video of the incident had surfaced online. Ambekar had earlier filed a complaint claiming that about 20 NCP workers had attacked him.

357.title: You spend more time drinking coffee & eating cheese: UK PM on work from home
357.article_body: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson in an interview said that working from home doesn’t work. Johnson said, "My experience of working from home is you spend an awful lot of time making another cup of coffee and then...walking very slowly to the fridge, hacking off a small piece of cheese...and then forgetting what...you were doing."

358.title: Hasaranga is like a brother, happy if he takes wickets: Chahal on purple cap
358.article_body: Talking about the competition for the IPL 2022 purple cap, spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who's currently the highest wicket-taker, said he's happy with the success of other bowlers. "I'm happy for Wanindu Hasaranga because he's like a brother to me. If he takes wickets, if Kuldeep Yadav takes wickets, I'm happy with that," he stated. Hasaranga is currently the second-highest wicket-taker.

359.title: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud elected as new President of Somalia
359.article_body: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud has been elected as the new President of Somalia after defeating the incumbent Mohamed Abdullahi Mohamed in a runoff. Mohamud bagged 214 votes in the runoff, while his rival Mohamed was limited to 110. Mohamud was sworn in immediately after the result. This would be his second five-year term after his initial stint from 2012 to 2017.

360.title: Which bowlers have taken first-ball wicket on their IPL debut?
360.article_body: CSK's 19-year-old fast bowler Matheesha Pathirana on Sunday became the ninth bowler to take first-ball wicket on his IPL debut. Ishant Sharma was the first bowler to achieve the feat in IPL after he dismissed Rahul Dravid, while playing for KKR against RCB. In 2009, three bowlers managed to take a first-ball wicket on their IPL debut.

361.title: Been playing for 15 years, this setup at GT is really good: Wriddhiman Saha
361.article_body: GT opener Wriddhiman Saha, who was named 'Man of the Match' for his performance against CSK, said he sees himself as an aggressive player in the powerplay and the franchise is also letting him play freely. "I've been playing for 15 years now, but this setup...is really good," he added. GT are at the top of the IPL points table.

362.title: I look up to my father-in-law; he's very humble & grounded: Anup on Raj Babbar
362.article_body: Speaking about his father-in-law Raj Babbar, actor Anup Soni said, "I look up to him because he also came from a...humble background and reached great heights. He's still very humble and grounded." "I always maintain...he's the only actor from the National School of Drama who played a commercial hero. We...have brilliant actors...but Raj Babbar did it all," Anup said.

363.title: Wasn't a good idea to bat first: Dhoni after 7-wicket loss to GT
363.article_body: After losing to the Gujarat Titans by seven wickets, CSK skipper MS Dhoni has admitted that it wasn't a "good idea" to bat first in the match. "The fast bowler's ball wasn't coming on. That's why the batsmen found it tough...In the second half, it got slightly better...More runs in the middle overs would have been good," Dhoni said.

364.title: We screamed for help for 1.5 hrs, no one heard: Mundka fire survivor
364.article_body: One of the survivors of the Mundka fire incident, Shazia Parveen, said that she and other people trapped inside the building kept screaming for help for one-and-a-half hours but nobody heard them. "We also tried to break the glass to reach the terrace...but were unable to do so," Shazia said, adding that they weren't allowed to use phones at work.

365.title: Delhi Metro commuters using smart cards more than pre-COVID days
365.article_body: There has been a significant rise in the share of Delhi Metro commuters using smart cards this year as compared to pre-COVID days, according to DMRC. Since January 2022, about 78% of the commuters are using smart cards, up from around 70% before the pandemic. Notably, DMRC had temporarily stopped the token system when it resumed services in 2020.

366.title: World's most valuable company Saudi Aramco's profits surge by over 80% in Q1
366.article_body: Saudi Aramco has said that its profits jumped by more than 80% in the first three months of the year. The first-quarter earnings of the firm showed a record net income of $39.5 billion, up from $21.7 billion during the same period last year. Notably, Saudi Aramco overtook Apple as the world’s most valuable company last week.

367.title: Group stone pelts people swimming in H'yana canal, 5 feared drowned
367.article_body: Five people are feared drowned after an alleged rival group pelted stones at around 9-10 people who were swimming in the Yamuna canal in Haryana's Yamunanagar on Sunday, police said. "Out of fear, people went deeper and...people who didn't know how to swim, drowned," DSP (Yamunanagar-1) Subhash Chand said. The two groups had an enmity from 2020, he added.

368.title: Abdullah family engineered Kashmiri pandits' destruction: BJP leader
368.article_body: BJP's Tarun Chugh said National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah is trying to play dual politics after "destroying" the Hindus in J&K. Chugh in an official statement said the Abdullah family engineered the "destruction" of Kashmiri pandits' families in J&K for its political gains. "Abdullahji, shedding crocodile tears in the name of Kashmiri pandits is of no use," Chugh stated.

369.title: Man attacks woman lawyer in Karnataka, kicks and slaps her in public; video surfaces
369.article_body: A woman lawyer was kicked and slapped repeatedly by her neighbour in Bagalkote district of Karnataka on Saturday. A video of the incident showing the man attacking the lawyer in public and no one coming to her rescue has gone viral on social media. According to police, he attacked the lawyer due to personal enmity regarding a civil dispute case.

370.title: Influencer raises ₹1.8 cr for Uber driver who helped her after she was robbed in US
370.article_body: A social media influencer raised over $2,40,000 (approximately ₹1.8 crore) via crowdfunding for an Uber driver after he helped her when she got robbed in California. The driver had helped her find her phone and credit card which were robbed during Coachella. The driver had revealed to her that his daughter was diagnosed with cancer, following which she started crowdfunding.

371.title: Speaking on movie more important for PM than Kashmiri Pandits genocide: Rahul
371.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has alleged that "it is more important for the Prime Minister to speak on a film than on the genocide of Kashmiri Pandits". "Terror is at its peak in Kashmir today due to the policies of BJP. Prime Minister, take the responsibility of security and try to bring peace," Gandhi tweeted.

372.title: Devotees rush to get coconut prasad at MP event, 17 injured in stampede
372.article_body: A stampede took place at a religious event in Madhya Pradesh's Bina when devotees rushed to receive the coconut prasad that was being distributed. Seventeen people were injured during the incident that took place at Bageshwar Dham temple at Khimlasa Road. An official said that there were around 25,000 people at the event when the incident took place.

373.title: Mundka fire victims' families give DNA samples to identify bodies
373.article_body: The family members of 24 of the 27 victims who died in Delhi's Mundka fire submitted their DNA samples to help identify the charred bodies found on the site, said police. The samples, submitted at Sanjay Gandhi Memorial Hospital, will be studied by forensic experts. The bodies of eight victims have been identified so far.

374.title: Folk singer Yogesh Gadhvi uses casteist slur at public event in Guj, booked
374.article_body: Police have booked folk and devotional singer Yogesh Gadhvi, also known as Yogesh Boxa, for allegedly using casteist slur against the Dalit community during his performance at a public event in Gujarat. Reports said that Yogesh was performing at the inauguration ceremony of a girl students' hostel in Radhakrishna Nagar. BJP state President CR Paatil was also present at event.

375.title: Centre not consulting states on national policies: Maharashtra Minister
375.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Subhash Desai has accused the Centre of not consulting states "while drafting new policies of national significance". "It must hear the views of the states. The dialogue that is needed between the two is not happening," Desai said. "If you take our views, we are not going to mislead you. We may protect our state's interest," he added.

376.title: Andrew Symonds' dogs survived car accident, one didn't leave his side: Eyewitness
376.article_body: Andrew Symonds' two blue heeler dogs survived the car accident which took the former Australia all-rounder's life. "One of them was very sensitive and didn't want to leave him. It would just growl at [us] every time we tried to move him or go near him," an eyewitness said. The forensic crash unit is investigating the accident.

377.title: Jet fuel prices hiked by 5% to climb new record high in Delhi
377.article_body: Prices of aviation turbine fuel (ATF) have been hiked by 5% to reach a record-high of ₹1,23,039.71 per kilolitre (₹123.03 per litre) in Delhi, as per a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. Jet fuel makes up 40% of the running cost of an airline and ATF prices have been hiked every fortnight since the beginning of 2022.

378.title: Vicky Kaushal's father shares throwback pic on son's 34th birthday
378.article_body: Vicky Kaushal's father, action director Sham Kaushal, took to Instagram on Monday to wish the actor on his 34th birthday. He shared a collage featuring Vicky's childhood picture, and wrote, "Wish you a very Happy Birthday Puttar. Always love and blessings...Feeling blessed and proud to have a son like you." Vicky's brother Sunny Kaushal also wished him on his birthday.

379.title: Matheesha Pathirana is an excellent death bowler: MS Dhoni
379.article_body: Praising 19-year-old Sri Lankan bowler Matheesha Pathirana, who made his debut for CSK against GT on Sunday, captain MS Dhoni said, "He is an excellent death bowler." Dhoni added, "A bit similar to Malinga...With a slingy action, Pathirana doesn't get a lot of bounce. He has got that slower one as well." Pathirana registered figures of 3.1-0-24-2 on debut.

380.title: Will legally reclaim all temples demolished by Mughals: Eshwarappa
380.article_body: BJP leader KS Eshwarappa on Sunday said all the temples demolished by Mughals should be reclaimed "legally". "In this country, 36,000 temples have been demolished by the Mughals from those times itself," Eshwarappa added. "Everyday news is coming out. Through the courts, without a fight or struggle, on the basis of the verdict, we will reclaim these temples," he stated.

381.title: Rahul to contest 2024 polls, he will rule the country: DK Shivakumar
381.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will contest the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and he will "rule the country". "We all are confident that Congress will come back under Rahul Gandhi's leadership...G23 has gone, the entire party is united and we all are one (on G23 push for the parliamentary board)," Shivakumar added.

382.title: India reports 2,202 new COVID-19 cases, 27 deaths in last 24 hours
382.article_body: India has reported 2,202 COVID-19 cases, 2,550 recoveries and 27 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,487 COVID-19 cases and 13 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,317, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,241.

383.title: IAF rescues 119 train passengers stranded in Assam due to heavy rain
383.article_body: The Indian Air Force helicopters rescued 119 passengers from Assam's Ditokchera railway station. While sharing pictures on social media, the Indian Air Force said that the train had been stranded at the railway station for over 24 hours due to incessant rains. Earlier, three people had lost their lives as rains had triggered landslides in parts of Dima Hasao district.

384.title: Moneylender extorts Pune couple despite getting repaid; 3 arrested
384.article_body: Three persons were arrested in connection with an extortion case in which a moneylender allegedly forced a Pune couple to pay him even after the loan was repaid. The complainant said they had borrowed ₹2 lakh and repaid around ₹12.24 lakh at 40% interest but the moneylender still forced them to sign property papers and grabbed their flat.

385.title: Up to 90% of our team will permanently work from home: Zerodha CEO
385.article_body: Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has said that 85-90% of his employees will permanently work from home. "People are enjoying living in their small towns. Belagavi has amazing talent and we have a large team working there. Folks are enjoying Belagavi...having maids and independent houses which they could never think of affording in Bengaluru," he said.

386.title: Met actors who show off; I manage with them: Panchayat 2 actor Raghubir
386.article_body: When asked how's it working with the new generation of actors, 'Panchayat' season 2 actor Raghubir Yadav said, "I never treat them as new actors because the work that we take up is new to us. I learn...from them. I try to become young with them." "I've met many actors who show off. I manage with such actors," he added.

387.title: Motivational speaker called to address employees among dead in Mundka fire
387.article_body: A 62-year-old motivational speaker, Kailash Jyani, who was called to address the employees of a commercial unit in Mundka was among those who died in the fire that broke out at a building near the Mundka metro station. His 37-year-old son who was accompanying him to venue also died in the incident. Fire broke out in building on May 13.

388.title: Sewage flows into Bengaluru's Haralur Lake, dead fish seen: Report
388.article_body: The condition of Bengaluru's Haralur Lake is deteriorating due to constant flow of sewage, following which dead fish were also seen in the waterbody last week, The Indian Express reported. "Death of fish is an indicator that...water quality isn't conducive," a lake conservationist said. The sewage flow is because BWSSB is "yet to lay...sanitary pipelines", a BBMP superintendent engineer claimed.

389.title: 4 Pune pub owners booked over operating past midnight, serving hookah
389.article_body: Pune police have booked the owners and managers of three pubs and bars for allegedly operating past midnight and one another for serving hookah to customers. During a raid on the pub serving hookah, the police also seized hookah pots, flavoured tobacco material and phones worth a total of about ₹89,600. Serving hookah was banned in Maharashtra in 2018.

390.title: Another mass shooting in US, 1 killed, 5 injured in California church attack
390.article_body: One person was killed, four were critically wounded and another person sustained minor injuries after a man opened fire at a California church. The gunman was "hogtied" by parishioners after the incident. The suspect, an Asian man in his 60s, was detained and two handguns were recovered. This comes after an 18-year-old man shot dead 10 people in New York.

391.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 10 bps; 2nd such hike in 2 months
391.article_body: State Bank of India has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across tenures with effect from May 15. Notably, this is SBI's second hike in MCLR in two months. An increase in MCLR will lead to a rise in EMIs for those who have availed home, vehicle and personal loans.

392.title: Once again the batting group wasn't able to perform collectively: Rahul
392.article_body: After their second straight defeat in the ongoing IPL season, LSG captain KL Rahul said, "Once again the batting group [wasn't] able to perform collectively." He added, "We have lost three-four games in the powerplay as a batting unit." Chasing RR's 178-run total, LSG scored 154/8 in 20 overs and suffered their fifth defeat in 13 games.

393.title: Fraudsters using fake UPI payment screenshots to cheat in Pune
393.article_body: Several cases of cheating by fraudsters who show fake UPI payment screenshots to cheat businessmen have been reported in Pune. The cyber crime police station recorded as many as 379 cheating complaints related to UPI-based platforms between January and April. In many instances, jewellers were cheated of large sums of money by frauds using fake payment screenshots.

394.title: Trolls call Amitabh Bachchan 'buddhe', accuse him of drinking desi liquor; he responds
394.article_body: A section of Facebook users trolled Amitabh Bachchan for his post on Sunday, wherein he wished his followers Good Morning at 11.26 am. A troll commented, "Abbey Buddhe, dopahar ho gayi hai," to which Amitabh wrote, "I pray to god...nobody insults you when you grow old." Another accused him of drinking desi liquor, with Amitabh responding that he doesn't drink.

395.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read with just 7 matches remaining?
395.article_body: With just seven matches remaining in IPL 2022 league stage, GT are the only team to have qualified for playoffs. They're assured of a top-two finish. Following their win against LSG, RR are now second on the table, followed by LSG. RCB (14 points), DC (12), KKR (12), PBKS (12) and SRH (10) are also in contention for playoffs spots.

396.title: He was someone I could call at 2:30 am and say 'Let's meet': Harbhajan on Symonds
396.article_body: Talking about his late MI teammate Andrew Symonds, Harbhajan Singh said, "We used to sit together, have a drink, laugh, share a lot of stories." He added, "He was someone I could call at 2:30 in the morning and say 'Hey mate, what are you doing? What are you up to? Let's meet' and he'd be up for it."

397.title: 10-yr-old Hyd boy enters swimming pool without safety tube, drowns
397.article_body: A 10-year-old boy drowned to death after he entered a swimming pool without safety tube in Hyderabad. The boy's aunt said that the management of the swimming pool did not have safety tubes. "There was no one...when he was drowning. We started shouting when we saw Manoj in the pool. The management people came after 10 minutes," his aunt added.

398.title: Adani to become India's 2nd biggest cement maker with $10.5 bn Holcim deal
398.article_body: Adani Group on Sunday acquired Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC in a $10.5 billion deal, making it the second-biggest cement producer in India. Ambuja and ACC have a combined capacity to produce at least 70 million tonnes of cement annually, second to UltraTech Cement's  120 million tonnes capacity. This will also be the largest-ever acquisition for Adani Group.

399.title: RR defeat LSG by 24 runs, move to 2nd position on IPL 2022 points table
399.article_body: RR defeated LSG by 24 runs at Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai to move to the second position on the IPL 2022 points table. RR and LSG have 16 points each, with RR having a superior net run-rate (NRR). RR put up a total of 178/6 with Yashasvi Jaiswal top-scoring with 41(29). LSG were restricted to 154/8 in their 20 overs.

400.title: NATO expects Turkey not to oppose membership of Finland, Sweden
400.article_body: NATO and the US on Sunday said that they expect Turkey not to oppose the membership of Finland and Sweden into the Western military alliance. Notably, Turkey had said that it had reservations about Finnish and Swedish membership. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan had claimed that the Nordic countries were home to many "terrorist organisations".
